Enum.name: SEC_2
Enum.description: MCU security status is unsecure

Enum.name: SEC_3
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: FSLACC_2
Enum.description: Freescale factory access denied

Enum.name: FSLACC_3
Enum.description: Freescale factory access granted

Enum.name: MEEN_2
Enum.description: Mass erase is disabled

Enum.name: MEEN_3
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_2
Enum.description: Backdoor key access enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_3
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled

Enum.name: LPBOOT_0
Enum.description: Low-power boot

Enum.name: LPBOOT_1
Enum.description: Normal boot

Enum.name: BOOTPIN_OPT_0
Enum.description: Force Boot from ROM if BOOTCFG0 asserted, where BOOTCFG0 is the boot config function which is muxed with NMI pin

Enum.name: BOOTPIN_OPT_1
Enum.description: Boot source configured by FOPT (BOOTSRC_SEL) bits

Enum.name: NMI_DIS_0
Enum.description: NMI interrupts are always blocked

Enum.name: NMI_DIS_1
Enum.description: NMI_b pin/interrupts reset default to enabled

Enum.name: RESET_PIN_CFG_0
Enum.description: RESET pin is disabled following a POR and cannot be enabled as reset function

Enum.name: RESET_PIN_CFG_1
Enum.description: RESET_b pin is dedicated

Enum.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_0
Enum.description: Boot from Flash

Enum.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_2
Enum.description: Boot from ROM

Enum.name: BOOTSRC_SEL_3
Enum.description: Boot from ROM

Enum.name: EDBG_0
Enum.description: When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.

Enum.name: EDBG_1
Enum.description: When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.

Enum.name: ERCA_0
Enum.description: Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .

Enum.name: ERCA_1
Enum.description: Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .

Enum.name: HOE_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: HOE_1
Enum.description: Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.

Enum.name: HALT_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: HALT_1
Enum.description: Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.

Enum.name: CLM_0
Enum.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

Enum.name: CLM_1
Enum.description: A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.

Enum.name: EMLM_0
Enum.description: Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enum.name: EMLM_1
Enum.description: Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.

Enum.name: ECX_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: ECX_1
Enum.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.

Enum.name: CX_0
Enum.description: Normal operation

Enum.name: CX_1
Enum.description: Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.

Enum.name: DBE_0
Enum.description: No destination bus error

Enum.name: DBE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write

Enum.name: SBE_0
Enum.description: No source bus error

Enum.name: SBE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read

Enum.name: SGE_0
Enum.description: No scatter/gather configuration error

Enum.name: SGE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.

Enum.name: NCE_0
Enum.description: No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

Enum.name: NCE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]

Enum.name: DOE_0
Enum.description: No destination offset configuration error

Enum.name: DOE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

Enum.name: DAE_0
Enum.description: No destination address configuration error

Enum.name: DAE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].

Enum.name: SOE_0
Enum.description: No source offset configuration error

Enum.name: SOE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

Enum.name: SAE_0
Enum.description: No source address configuration error.

Enum.name: SAE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

BitField.name: ERRCHN
BitField.description: Error Channel Number or Canceled Channel Number

Enum.name: CPE_0
Enum.description: No channel priority error

Enum.name: CPE_1
Enum.description: The last recorded error was a configuration error in the channel priorities . Channel priorities are not unique.

Enum.name: ECX_0
Enum.description: No canceled transfers

Enum.name: ECX_1
Enum.description: The last recorded entry was a canceled transfer by the error cancel transfer input

BitField.name: VLD
BitField.description: Logical OR of all ERR status bits

Enum.name: VLD_0
Enum.description: No ERR bits are set.

Enum.name: VLD_1
Enum.description: At least one ERR bit is set indicating a valid error exists that has not been cleared.

Enum.name: START_0
Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_0
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTMAJOR_1
Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.name: INTHALF_0
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: INTHALF_1
Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK
BitField.description: Enable channel-to-channel linking on major loop complete

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_1
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: DREQ_0
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.

Enum.name: DREQ_1
Enum.description: The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.

Enum.name: ESG_0
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD is normal format.

Enum.name: ESG_1
Enum.description: The current channel's TCD specifies a scatter gather format. The DLASTSGA field provides a memory pointer to the next TCD to be loaded into this channel after the major loop completes its execution.

BitField.name: MAJORELINK

Enum.name: MAJORELINK_0
Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is disabled.

Enum.description: The channel-to-channel linking is enabled.

Enum.name: BWC_0
Enum.description: No eDMA engine stalls.

Enum.name: BWC_2
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 4 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.name: BWC_3
Enum.description: eDMA engine stalls for 8 cycles after each R/W.

Enum.description: The channel is not explicitly started.

Enum.name: START_1
Enum.description: The channel is explicitly started via a software initiated service request.

BitField.name: M0UM
BitField.description: Bus Master 0 User Mode Access Control

BitField.name: M0SM
BitField.description: Bus Master 0 Supervisor Mode Access Control

BitField.name: M1UM
BitField.description: Bus Master 1 User Mode Access Control

BitField.name: M1SM
BitField.description: Bus Master 1 Supervisor Mode Access Control

BitField.name: M2UM
BitField.description: Bus Master 2 User Mode Access control

BitField.name: M2SM
BitField.description: Bus Master 2 Supervisor Mode Access Control

BitField.name: M3UM
BitField.description: Bus Master 3 User Mode Access Control

Enum.name: M3UM_0
Enum.description: An attempted access of that mode may be terminated with an access error (if not allowed by another descriptor) and the access not performed.

Enum.name: M3UM_1
Enum.description: Allows the given access type to occur

BitField.name: M3SM
BitField.description: Bus Master 3 Supervisor Mode Access Control

Enum.name: M3SM_0
Enum.description: r/w/x; read, write and execute allowed

Enum.name: M3SM_1
Enum.description: r/x; read and execute allowed, but no write

Enum.name: M3SM_2
Enum.description: r/w; read and write allowed, but no execute

Enum.name: M3SM_3
Enum.description: Same as User mode defined in M3UM

Enum.name: M3PE_0
Enum.description: Do not include the process identifier in the evaluation

Enum.name: M3PE_1
Enum.description: Include the process identifier and mask (RGDn_WORD3) in the region hit evaluation

Enum.name: M4WE_0
Enum.description: Bus master 4 writes terminate with an access error and the write is not performed

Enum.name: M4WE_1
Enum.description: Bus master 4 writes allowed

Enum.name: M4RE_0
Enum.description: Bus master 4 reads terminate with an access error and the read is not performed

Enum.name: M4RE_1
Enum.description: Bus master 4 reads allowed

Enum.name: M5WE_0
Enum.description: Bus master 5 writes terminate with an access error and the write is not performed

Enum.name: M5WE_1
Enum.description: Bus master 5 writes allowed

Enum.name: M5RE_0
Enum.description: Bus master 5 reads terminate with an access error and the read is not performed

Enum.name: M5RE_1
Enum.description: Bus master 5 reads allowed

Enum.name: M6WE_0
Enum.description: Bus master 6 writes terminate with an access error and the write is not performed

Enum.name: M6WE_1

BitField.name: MGSTAT0
BitField.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

Enum.name: FPVIOL_0
Enum.description: No protection violation detected

Enum.name: FPVIOL_1
Enum.description: Protection violation detected

Enum.name: ACCERR_0
Enum.description: No access error detected

Enum.name: ACCERR_1
Enum.description: Access error detected

Enum.name: RDCOLERR_0
Enum.description: No collision error detected

Enum.name: RDCOLERR_1
Enum.description: Collision error detected

Enum.name: CCIF_0
Enum.description: FTFE command or EEPROM file system operation in progress

Enum.name: CCIF_1
Enum.description: FTFE command or EEPROM file system operation has completed

BitField.name: EEERDY
BitField.description: This flag indicates if the EEPROM backup data has been copied to the FlexRAM and is therefore available for read access

Enum.name: EEERDY_0
Enum.description: FlexRAM is not available for EEPROM operation

Enum.name: EEERDY_1
Enum.description: FlexRAM is available for EEPROM operations where: reads from the FlexRAM return data previously written to the FlexRAM in EEPROM mode and writes launch an EEPROM operation to store the written data in the FlexRAM and EEPROM backup

Enum.name: RAMRDY_0
Enum.description: FlexRAM is not available for traditional RAM access

Enum.name: RAMRDY_1
Enum.description: FlexRAM is available as traditional RAM only; writes to the FlexRAM do not trigger EEPROM operations

Enum.name: PFLSH_0
Enum.description: FTFE configuration supports one program flash block and one FlexNVM block

Enum.name: ERSSUSP_0
Enum.description: No suspend requested

Enum.name: ERSSUSP_1
Enum.description: Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution

Enum.name: ERSAREQ_0
Enum.description: No request or request complete

Enum.name: ERSAREQ_1
Enum.description: Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state

Enum.name: RDCOLLIE_0
Enum.description: Read collision error interrupt disabled

Enum.name: RDCOLLIE_1
Enum.description: Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever an FTFE read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).

Enum.name: CCIE_0
Enum.description: Command complete interrupt disabled

Enum.name: CCIE_1
Enum.description: Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.

Enum.name: SEC_0
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: SEC_1
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: SEC_2
Enum.description: MCU security status is unsecure (The standard shipping condition of the FTFE is unsecure.)

Enum.name: SEC_3
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure

Enum.name: FSLACC_0
Enum.description: Factory access granted

Enum.name: FSLACC_1
Enum.description: Factory access denied

Enum.name: FSLACC_2
Enum.description: Factory access denied

Enum.name: FSLACC_3
Enum.description: Factory access granted

Enum.name: MEEN_0
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: MEEN_1
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: MEEN_2
Enum.description: Mass erase is disabled

Enum.name: MEEN_3
Enum.description: Mass erase is enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_0
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_1
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)

Enum.name: KEYEN_2
Enum.description: Backdoor key access enabled

Enum.name: KEYEN_3
Enum.description: Backdoor key access disabled

Enum.description: Program flash memory is divided into 48 segments (768 Kbytes, 1.5 Mbytes)

Enum.name: NUMSG_64
Enum.description: Program flash memory is divided into 64 segments (256 Kbytes, 512 Kbytes, 1 Mbyte, 2 Mbytes)

BitField.name: DFDIF
BitField.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: DFDIF_0
Enum.description: Double bit fault not detected during a valid flash read access from the platform flash controller

Enum.name: DFDIF_1
Enum.description: Double bit fault detected (or FERCNFG[FDFD] is set) during a valid flash read access from the platform flash controller

BitField.name: DFDIE
BitField.description: Double Bit Fault Detect Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: DFDIE_0
Enum.description: Double bit fault detect interrupt disabled

Enum.name: DFDIE_1
Enum.description: Double bit fault detect interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FERSTAT[DFDIF] flag is set.

Enum.name: FDFD_0
Enum.description: FERSTAT[DFDIF] sets only if a double bit fault is detected during read access from the platform flash controller

Enum.name: FDFD_1
Enum.description: FERSTAT[DFDIF] sets during any valid flash read access from the platform flash controller. An interrupt request is generated if the DFDIE bit is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Triggering is disabled. If triggering is disabled and ENBL is set, the DMA Channel will simply route the specified source to the DMA channel. (Normal mode)

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Triggering is enabled. If triggering is enabled and ENBL is set, the DMAMUX is in Periodic Trigger mode.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: DMA channel is disabled. This mode is primarily used during configuration of the DMAMux. The DMA has separate channel enables/disables, which should be used to disable or reconfigure a DMA channel.

BitField.name: MAXMB
BitField.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

Enum.name: IDAM_0
Enum.description: Format A: One full ID (standard and extended) per ID Filter Table element.

Enum.name: IDAM_1
Enum.description: Format B: Two full standard IDs or two partial 14-bit (standard and extended) IDs per ID Filter Table element.

Enum.name: IDAM_2
Enum.description: Format C: Four partial 8-bit Standard IDs per ID Filter Table element.

Enum.name: IDAM_3
Enum.description: Format D: All frames rejected.

Enum.name: AEN_0
Enum.description: Abort disabled.

Enum.name: AEN_1
Enum.description: Abort enabled.

Enum.name: LPRIOEN_0
Enum.description: Local Priority disabled.

Enum.name: LPRIOEN_1
Enum.description: Local Priority enabled.

Enum.name: DMA_0
Enum.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_1
Enum.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO enabled.

BitField.name: IRMQ
BitField.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

Enum.name: IRMQ_0
Enum.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are disabled. For backward compatibility with legacy applications, the reading of C/S word locks the MB even if it is EMPTY.

Enum.name: IRMQ_1
Enum.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are enabled.

Enum.name: SRXDIS_0
Enum.description: Self reception enabled.

Enum.name: SRXDIS_1
Enum.description: Self reception disabled.

Enum.name: WAKSRC_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN uses the unfiltered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: WAKSRC_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN uses the filtered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: LPMACK_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not in a low-power mode.

Enum.name: LPMACK_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is in a low-power mode.

Enum.name: WRNEN_0
Enum.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are zero, independent of the values in the error counters.

Enum.name: WRNEN_1
Enum.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are set when the respective error counter transitions from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: SLFWAK_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is disabled.

Enum.name: SLFWAK_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is enabled.

Enum.name: SUPV_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is in User mode. Affected registers allow both Supervisor and Unrestricted accesses.

Enum.name: SUPV_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is in Supervisor mode. Affected registers allow only Supervisor access. Unrestricted access behaves as though the access was done to an unimplemented register location.

Enum.name: FRZACK_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN not in Freeze mode, prescaler running.

Enum.name: FRZACK_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN in Freeze mode, prescaler stopped.

Enum.name: SOFTRST_0
Enum.description: No reset request.

Enum.name: SOFTRST_1
Enum.description: Resets the registers affected by soft reset.

Enum.name: WAKMSK_0
Enum.description: Wake Up Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: WAKMSK_1
Enum.description: Wake Up Interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: NOTRDY_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN module is either in Normal mode, Listen-Only mode or Loop-Back mode.

Enum.name: NOTRDY_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module is either in Disable mode, Stop mode or Freeze mode.

Enum.name: HALT_0
Enum.description: No Freeze mode request.

Enum.name: HALT_1
Enum.description: Enters Freeze mode if the FRZ bit is asserted.

Enum.name: RFEN_0
Enum.description: Rx FIFO not enabled.

Enum.name: RFEN_1
Enum.description: Rx FIFO enabled.

Enum.name: FRZ_0
Enum.description: Not enabled to enter Freeze mode.

Enum.name: FRZ_1
Enum.description: Enabled to enter Freeze mode.

Enum.name: MDIS_0
Enum.description: Enable the FlexCAN module.

Enum.name: MDIS_1
Enum.description: Disable the FlexCAN module.

Enum.name: LOM_0
Enum.description: Listen-Only mode is deactivated.

Enum.name: LOM_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module operates in Listen-Only mode.

Enum.name: LBUF_0
Enum.description: Buffer with highest priority is transmitted first.

Enum.name: LBUF_1
Enum.description: Lowest number buffer is transmitted first.

Enum.name: TSYN_0
Enum.description: Timer Sync feature disabled

Enum.name: TSYN_1
Enum.description: Timer Sync feature enabled

Enum.name: BOFFREC_0
Enum.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state enabled.

Enum.name: BOFFREC_1
Enum.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state disabled.

Enum.name: SMP_0
Enum.description: Just one sample is used to determine the bit value.

Enum.name: SMP_1
Enum.description: Three samples are used to determine the value of the received bit: the regular one (sample point) and 2 preceding samples; a majority rule is used.

Enum.name: RWRNMSK_0
Enum.description: Rx Warning Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RWRNMSK_1
Enum.description: Rx Warning Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TWRNMSK_0
Enum.description: Tx Warning Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TWRNMSK_1
Enum.description: Tx Warning Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: LPB_0
Enum.description: Loop Back disabled.

Enum.name: LPB_1
Enum.description: Loop Back enabled.

Enum.name: CLKSRC_0
Enum.description: The CAN engine clock source is the oscillator clock. Under this condition, the oscillator clock frequency must be lower than the bus clock.

Enum.name: CLKSRC_1
Enum.description: The CAN engine clock source is the peripheral clock.

Enum.name: ERRMSK_0
Enum.description: Error interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: ERRMSK_1
Enum.description: Error interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: BOFFMSK_0
Enum.description: Bus Off interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: BOFFMSK_1
Enum.description: Bus Off interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: MG_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: MG_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: RX14M_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: RX14M_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: RX15M_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: RX15M_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: WAKINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: WAKINT_1
Enum.description: Indicates a recessive to dominant transition was received on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: ERRINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: ERRINT_1
Enum.description: Indicates setting of any Error Bit in the Error and Status Register.

Enum.name: BOFFINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BOFFINT_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module entered Bus Off state.

Enum.name: RX_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not receiving a message.

Enum.name: RX_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is receiving a message.

Enum.name: FLTCONF_0
Enum.description: Error Active

Enum.name: FLTCONF_1
Enum.description: Error Passive

Enum.name: FLTCONF_2
Enum.description: Bus Off

Enum.name: TX_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not transmitting a message.

Enum.name: TX_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is transmitting a message.

BitField.name: IDLE
BitField.description: This bit indicates when CAN bus is in IDLE state

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: CAN bus is now IDLE.

Enum.name: RXWRN_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: RXWRN_1
Enum.description: RXERRCNT is greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: TXWRN_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: TXWRN_1
Enum.description: TXERRCNT is greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: STFERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: STFERR_1
Enum.description: A Stuffing Error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: FRMERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: FRMERR_1
Enum.description: A Form Error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: CRCERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: CRCERR_1
Enum.description: A CRC error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: ACKERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: ACKERR_1
Enum.description: An ACK error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: BIT0ERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BIT0ERR_1
Enum.description: At least one bit sent as dominant is received as recessive.

Enum.name: BIT1ERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BIT1ERR_1
Enum.description: At least one bit sent as recessive is received as dominant.

Enum.name: RWRNINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: RWRNINT_1
Enum.description: The Rx error counter transitioned from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: TWRNINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: TWRNINT_1
Enum.description: The Tx error counter transitioned from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: SYNCH_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not synchronized to the CAN bus.

Enum.name: SYNCH_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is synchronized to the CAN bus.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEINT_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module has completed Bus Off process.

Enum.name: ERROVR_0
Enum.description: Overrun has not occurred.

Enum.name: ERROVR_1
Enum.description: Overrun has occurred.

Enum.name: BUF31TO0M_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: BUF31TO0M_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer Interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: BUF0I
BitField.description: Buffer MB0 Interrupt Or Clear FIFO bit

Enum.name: BUF0I_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

Enum.name: BUF0I_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

Enum.name: BUF4TO1I_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

Enum.name: BUF4TO1I_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

BitField.name: BUF5I
BitField.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

Enum.name: BUF5I_0
Enum.description: No occurrence of MB5 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of frame(s) available in the FIFO, when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF5I_1
Enum.description: MB5 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or frame(s) available in the Rx FIFO when MCR[RFEN]=1. It generates a DMA request in case of MCR[RFEN] and MCR[DMA] are enabled.

BitField.name: BUF6I
BitField.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Warning"

Enum.name: BUF6I_0
Enum.description: No occurrence of MB6 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF6I_1
Enum.description: MB6 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

BitField.name: BUF7I
BitField.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Overflow"

Enum.name: BUF7I_0
Enum.description: No occurrence of MB7 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF7I_1
Enum.description: MB7 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF31TO8I_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception.

Enum.name: BUF31TO8I_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception.

Enum.name: EDFLTDIS_0
Enum.description: Edge Filter is enabled.

Enum.name: EDFLTDIS_1
Enum.description: Edge Filter is disabled.

Enum.name: ISOCANFDEN_0
Enum.description: Stuff Count feature is disabled. Stuff Count bit field is not inserted before the CRC Sequence field.

Enum.name: ISOCANFDEN_1
Enum.description: Stuff Count feature is enabled. Stuff Count bit field is inserted before the CRC Sequence field.

Enum.name: PREXCEN_0
Enum.description: Protocol Exception is disabled.

Enum.name: PREXCEN_1
Enum.description: Protocol Exception is enabled.

Enum.name: TIMER_SRC_0
Enum.description: The Free Running Timer is clocked by the CAN bit clock, which defines the baud rate on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: TIMER_SRC_1
Enum.description: The Free Running Timer is clocked by an external time tick. The period can be either adjusted to be equal to the baud rate on the CAN bus, or a different value as required. See the device specific section for details about the external time tick.

BitField.name: EACEN
BitField.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

Enum.name: EACEN_0
Enum.description: Rx Mailbox filter's IDE bit is always compared and RTR is never compared despite mask bits.

Enum.name: EACEN_1
Enum.description: Enables the comparison of both Rx Mailbox filter's IDE and RTR bit with their corresponding bits within the incoming frame. Mask bits do apply.

Enum.name: RRS_0
Enum.description: Remote Response Frame is generated.

Enum.name: RRS_1
Enum.description: Remote Request Frame is stored.

Enum.name: MRP_0
Enum.description: Matching starts from Rx FIFO and continues on Mailboxes.

Enum.name: MRP_1
Enum.description: Matching starts from Mailboxes and continues on Rx FIFO.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEMSK_0
Enum.description: Bus Off Done interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEMSK_1
Enum.description: Bus Off Done interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: IMB_0
Enum.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, the ESR2[LPTM] is not an inactive Mailbox.

Enum.name: IMB_1
Enum.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, there is at least one inactive Mailbox. LPTM content is the number of the first one.

Enum.name: VPS_0
Enum.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are invalid.

Enum.name: VPS_1
Enum.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are valid.

Enum.name: FGM_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: FGM_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: BTF_0
Enum.description: Extended bit time definitions disabled.

Enum.name: BTF_1
Enum.description: Extended bit time definitions enabled.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: MAXMB
BitField.description: Number Of The Last Message Buffer

Enum.name: IDAM_0
Enum.description: Format A: One full ID (standard and extended) per ID Filter Table element.

Enum.name: IDAM_1
Enum.description: Format B: Two full standard IDs or two partial 14-bit (standard and extended) IDs per ID Filter Table element.

Enum.name: IDAM_2
Enum.description: Format C: Four partial 8-bit Standard IDs per ID Filter Table element.

Enum.name: IDAM_3
Enum.description: Format D: All frames rejected.

Enum.name: AEN_0
Enum.description: Abort disabled.

Enum.name: AEN_1
Enum.description: Abort enabled.

Enum.name: LPRIOEN_0
Enum.description: Local Priority disabled.

Enum.name: LPRIOEN_1
Enum.description: Local Priority enabled.

Enum.name: DMA_0
Enum.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_1
Enum.description: DMA feature for RX FIFO enabled.

BitField.name: IRMQ
BitField.description: Individual Rx Masking And Queue Enable

Enum.name: IRMQ_0
Enum.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are disabled. For backward compatibility with legacy applications, the reading of C/S word locks the MB even if it is EMPTY.

Enum.name: IRMQ_1
Enum.description: Individual Rx masking and queue feature are enabled.

Enum.name: SRXDIS_0
Enum.description: Self reception enabled.

Enum.name: SRXDIS_1
Enum.description: Self reception disabled.

Enum.name: WAKSRC_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN uses the unfiltered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: WAKSRC_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN uses the filtered Rx input to detect recessive to dominant edges on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: LPMACK_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not in a low-power mode.

Enum.name: LPMACK_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is in a low-power mode.

Enum.name: WRNEN_0
Enum.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are zero, independent of the values in the error counters.

Enum.name: WRNEN_1
Enum.description: TWRNINT and RWRNINT bits are set when the respective error counter transitions from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: SLFWAK_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is disabled.

Enum.name: SLFWAK_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN Self Wake Up feature is enabled.

Enum.name: SUPV_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is in User mode. Affected registers allow both Supervisor and Unrestricted accesses.

Enum.name: SUPV_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is in Supervisor mode. Affected registers allow only Supervisor access. Unrestricted access behaves as though the access was done to an unimplemented register location.

Enum.name: FRZACK_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN not in Freeze mode, prescaler running.

Enum.name: FRZACK_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN in Freeze mode, prescaler stopped.

Enum.name: SOFTRST_0
Enum.description: No reset request.

Enum.name: SOFTRST_1
Enum.description: Resets the registers affected by soft reset.

Enum.name: WAKMSK_0
Enum.description: Wake Up Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: WAKMSK_1
Enum.description: Wake Up Interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: NOTRDY_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN module is either in Normal mode, Listen-Only mode or Loop-Back mode.

Enum.name: NOTRDY_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module is either in Disable mode, Stop mode or Freeze mode.

Enum.name: HALT_0
Enum.description: No Freeze mode request.

Enum.name: HALT_1
Enum.description: Enters Freeze mode if the FRZ bit is asserted.

Enum.name: RFEN_0
Enum.description: Rx FIFO not enabled.

Enum.name: RFEN_1
Enum.description: Rx FIFO enabled.

Enum.name: FRZ_0
Enum.description: Not enabled to enter Freeze mode.

Enum.name: FRZ_1
Enum.description: Enabled to enter Freeze mode.

Enum.name: MDIS_0
Enum.description: Enable the FlexCAN module.

Enum.name: MDIS_1
Enum.description: Disable the FlexCAN module.

Enum.name: LOM_0
Enum.description: Listen-Only mode is deactivated.

Enum.name: LOM_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module operates in Listen-Only mode.

Enum.name: LBUF_0
Enum.description: Buffer with highest priority is transmitted first.

Enum.name: LBUF_1
Enum.description: Lowest number buffer is transmitted first.

Enum.name: TSYN_0
Enum.description: Timer Sync feature disabled

Enum.name: TSYN_1
Enum.description: Timer Sync feature enabled

Enum.name: BOFFREC_0
Enum.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state enabled.

Enum.name: BOFFREC_1
Enum.description: Automatic recovering from Bus Off state disabled.

Enum.name: SMP_0
Enum.description: Just one sample is used to determine the bit value.

Enum.name: SMP_1
Enum.description: Three samples are used to determine the value of the received bit: the regular one (sample point) and 2 preceding samples; a majority rule is used.

Enum.name: RWRNMSK_0
Enum.description: Rx Warning Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RWRNMSK_1
Enum.description: Rx Warning Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TWRNMSK_0
Enum.description: Tx Warning Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TWRNMSK_1
Enum.description: Tx Warning Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: LPB_0
Enum.description: Loop Back disabled.

Enum.name: LPB_1
Enum.description: Loop Back enabled.

Enum.name: CLKSRC_0
Enum.description: The CAN engine clock source is the oscillator clock. Under this condition, the oscillator clock frequency must be lower than the bus clock.

Enum.name: CLKSRC_1
Enum.description: The CAN engine clock source is the peripheral clock.

Enum.name: ERRMSK_0
Enum.description: Error interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: ERRMSK_1
Enum.description: Error interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: BOFFMSK_0
Enum.description: Bus Off interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: BOFFMSK_1
Enum.description: Bus Off interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: MG_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: MG_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: RX14M_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: RX14M_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: RX15M_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: RX15M_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: WAKINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: WAKINT_1
Enum.description: Indicates a recessive to dominant transition was received on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: ERRINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: ERRINT_1
Enum.description: Indicates setting of any Error Bit in the Error and Status Register.

Enum.name: BOFFINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BOFFINT_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module entered Bus Off state.

Enum.name: RX_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not receiving a message.

Enum.name: RX_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is receiving a message.

Enum.name: FLTCONF_0
Enum.description: Error Active

Enum.name: FLTCONF_1
Enum.description: Error Passive

Enum.name: FLTCONF_2
Enum.description: Bus Off

Enum.name: TX_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not transmitting a message.

Enum.name: TX_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is transmitting a message.

BitField.name: IDLE
BitField.description: This bit indicates when CAN bus is in IDLE state

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: CAN bus is now IDLE.

Enum.name: RXWRN_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: RXWRN_1
Enum.description: RXERRCNT is greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: TXWRN_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: TXWRN_1
Enum.description: TXERRCNT is greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: STFERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: STFERR_1
Enum.description: A Stuffing Error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: FRMERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: FRMERR_1
Enum.description: A Form Error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: CRCERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: CRCERR_1
Enum.description: A CRC error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: ACKERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: ACKERR_1
Enum.description: An ACK error occurred since last read of this register.

Enum.name: BIT0ERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BIT0ERR_1
Enum.description: At least one bit sent as dominant is received as recessive.

Enum.name: BIT1ERR_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BIT1ERR_1
Enum.description: At least one bit sent as recessive is received as dominant.

Enum.name: RWRNINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: RWRNINT_1
Enum.description: The Rx error counter transitioned from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: TWRNINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: TWRNINT_1
Enum.description: The Tx error counter transitioned from less than 96 to greater than or equal to 96.

Enum.name: SYNCH_0
Enum.description: FlexCAN is not synchronized to the CAN bus.

Enum.name: SYNCH_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN is synchronized to the CAN bus.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEINT_0
Enum.description: No such occurrence.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEINT_1
Enum.description: FlexCAN module has completed Bus Off process.

Enum.name: ERROVR_0
Enum.description: Overrun has not occurred.

Enum.name: ERROVR_1
Enum.description: Overrun has occurred.

Enum.name: BUF31TO0M_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: BUF31TO0M_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer Interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: BUF0I
BitField.description: Buffer MB0 Interrupt Or Clear FIFO bit

Enum.name: BUF0I_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

Enum.name: BUF0I_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

Enum.name: BUF4TO1I_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

Enum.name: BUF4TO1I_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception when MCR[RFEN]=0.

BitField.name: BUF5I
BitField.description: Buffer MB5 Interrupt Or "Frames available in Rx FIFO"

Enum.name: BUF5I_0
Enum.description: No occurrence of MB5 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of frame(s) available in the FIFO, when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF5I_1
Enum.description: MB5 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or frame(s) available in the Rx FIFO when MCR[RFEN]=1. It generates a DMA request in case of MCR[RFEN] and MCR[DMA] are enabled.

BitField.name: BUF6I
BitField.description: Buffer MB6 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Warning"

Enum.name: BUF6I_0
Enum.description: No occurrence of MB6 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF6I_1
Enum.description: MB6 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO almost full when MCR[RFEN]=1

BitField.name: BUF7I
BitField.description: Buffer MB7 Interrupt Or "Rx FIFO Overflow"

Enum.name: BUF7I_0
Enum.description: No occurrence of MB7 completing transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or of Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF7I_1
Enum.description: MB7 completed transmission/reception when MCR[RFEN]=0, or Rx FIFO overflow when MCR[RFEN]=1

Enum.name: BUF31TO8I_0
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has no occurrence of successfully completed transmission or reception.

Enum.name: BUF31TO8I_1
Enum.description: The corresponding buffer has successfully completed transmission or reception.

Enum.name: EDFLTDIS_0
Enum.description: Edge Filter is enabled.

Enum.name: EDFLTDIS_1
Enum.description: Edge Filter is disabled.

Enum.name: ISOCANFDEN_0
Enum.description: Stuff Count feature is disabled. Stuff Count bit field is not inserted before the CRC Sequence field.

Enum.name: ISOCANFDEN_1
Enum.description: Stuff Count feature is enabled. Stuff Count bit field is inserted before the CRC Sequence field.

Enum.name: PREXCEN_0
Enum.description: Protocol Exception is disabled.

Enum.name: PREXCEN_1
Enum.description: Protocol Exception is enabled.

Enum.name: TIMER_SRC_0
Enum.description: The Free Running Timer is clocked by the CAN bit clock, which defines the baud rate on the CAN bus.

Enum.name: TIMER_SRC_1
Enum.description: The Free Running Timer is clocked by an external time tick. The period can be either adjusted to be equal to the baud rate on the CAN bus, or a different value as required. See the device specific section for details about the external time tick.

BitField.name: EACEN
BitField.description: Entire Frame Arbitration Field Comparison Enable For Rx Mailboxes

Enum.name: EACEN_0
Enum.description: Rx Mailbox filter's IDE bit is always compared and RTR is never compared despite mask bits.

Enum.name: EACEN_1
Enum.description: Enables the comparison of both Rx Mailbox filter's IDE and RTR bit with their corresponding bits within the incoming frame. Mask bits do apply.

Enum.name: RRS_0
Enum.description: Remote Response Frame is generated.

Enum.name: RRS_1
Enum.description: Remote Request Frame is stored.

Enum.name: MRP_0
Enum.description: Matching starts from Rx FIFO and continues on Mailboxes.

Enum.name: MRP_1
Enum.description: Matching starts from Mailboxes and continues on Rx FIFO.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEMSK_0
Enum.description: Bus Off Done interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: BOFFDONEMSK_1
Enum.description: Bus Off Done interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: IMB_0
Enum.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, the ESR2[LPTM] is not an inactive Mailbox.

Enum.name: IMB_1
Enum.description: If ESR2[VPS] is asserted, there is at least one inactive Mailbox. LPTM content is the number of the first one.

Enum.name: VPS_0
Enum.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are invalid.

Enum.name: VPS_1
Enum.description: Contents of IMB and LPTM are valid.

Enum.name: FGM_0
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is "don't care."

Enum.name: FGM_1
Enum.description: The corresponding bit in the filter is checked.

Enum.name: BTF_0
Enum.description: Extended bit time definitions disabled.

Enum.name: BTF_1
Enum.description: Extended bit time definitions enabled.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

BitField.name: IDE
BitField.description: ID Extended. One/zero for extended/standard format frame.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.description: Substitute Remote Request. Contains a fixed recessive bit.

BitField.name: EXT
BitField.description: Contains extended (LOW word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: STD
BitField.description: Contains standard/extended (HIGH word) identifier of message buffer.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: Local priority. This 3-bit fieldis only used when LPRIO_EN bit is set in MCR and it only makes sense for Tx buffers. These bits are not transmitted. They are appended to the regular ID to define the transmission priority.

BitField.name: TIME_STAMP
BitField.description: Free-Running Counter Time stamp. This 16-bit field is a copy of the Free-Running Timer, captured for Tx and Rx frames at the time when the beginning of the Identifier field appears on the CAN bus.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Length of the data to be stored/transmitted.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: Remote Transmission Request. One/zero for remote/data frame.

Enum.name: FEATURE_4
Enum.description: Standard feature set supporting 32-bit shift register.

Enum.name: MEN_0
Enum.description: Module is disabled.

Enum.name: MEN_1
Enum.description: Module is enabled.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Master logic is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Master logic is reset.

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: Module is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: Module is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: Module is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: Module is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: RTF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RTF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: RRF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RRF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: TDF_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not requested.

Enum.name: TDF_1
Enum.description: Transmit data is requested.

Enum.name: RDF_0
Enum.description: Receive Data is not ready.

Enum.name: RDF_1
Enum.description: Receive data is ready.

Enum.name: WCF_0
Enum.description: Transfer word not completed.

Enum.name: WCF_1
Enum.description: Transfer word completed.

Enum.name: FCF_0
Enum.description: Frame transfer has not completed.

Enum.name: FCF_1
Enum.description: Frame transfer has completed.

Enum.name: TCF_0
Enum.description: All transfers have not completed.

Enum.name: TCF_1
Enum.description: All transfers have completed.

Enum.name: TEF_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO underrun has not occurred.

Enum.name: TEF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO underrun has occurred

Enum.name: REF_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO has not overflowed.

Enum.name: REF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO has overflowed.

Enum.name: DMF_0
Enum.description: Have not received matching data.

Enum.name: DMF_1
Enum.description: Have received matching data.

Enum.name: MBF_0
Enum.description: LPSPI is idle.

Enum.name: MBF_1
Enum.description: LPSPI is busy.

Enum.name: TDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled

Enum.name: RDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: WCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: WCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: FCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: FCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TEIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TEIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: REIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: REIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: HREN_0
Enum.description: Host request is disabled.

Enum.name: HREN_1
Enum.description: Host request is enabled.

Enum.name: HRPOL_0
Enum.description: Active low.

Enum.name: HRPOL_1
Enum.description: Active high.

Enum.name: HRSEL_0
Enum.description: Host request input is pin LPSPI_HREQ.

Enum.name: HRSEL_1
Enum.description: Host request input is input trigger.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_0
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is disabled.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_1
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is enabled.

Enum.name: RDMO_0
Enum.description: Received data is stored in the receive FIFO as normal.

Enum.name: RDMO_1
Enum.description: Received data is discarded unless the DMF is set.

Enum.name: MASTER_0
Enum.description: Slave mode.

Enum.name: MASTER_1
Enum.description: Master mode.

Enum.name: SAMPLE_0
Enum.description: Input data sampled on SCK edge.

Enum.name: SAMPLE_1
Enum.description: Input data sampled on delayed SCK edge.

Enum.name: AUTOPCS_0
Enum.description: Automatic PCS generation disabled.

Enum.name: AUTOPCS_1
Enum.description: Automatic PCS generation enabled.

Enum.name: NOSTALL_0
Enum.description: Transfers will stall when transmit FIFO is empty or receive FIFO is full.

Enum.name: NOSTALL_1
Enum.description: Transfers will not stall, allowing transmit FIFO underrun or receive FIFO overrun to occur.

Enum.name: PCSPOL_0
Enum.description: The PCSx is active low.

Enum.name: PCSPOL_1
Enum.description: The PCSx is active high.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match disabled.

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: SIN is used for input data and SOUT for output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: SIN is used for both input and output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_2
Enum.description: SOUT is used for both input and output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_3
Enum.description: SOUT is used for input data and SIN for output data.

Enum.name: OUTCFG_0
Enum.description: Output data retains last value when chip select is negated.

Enum.name: OUTCFG_1
Enum.description: Output data is tristated when chip select is negated.

Enum.name: PCSCFG_0
Enum.description: PCS[3:2] are enabled.

Enum.name: PCSCFG_1
Enum.description: PCS[3:2] are disabled.

Enum.name: WIDTH_0
Enum.description: Single bit transfer.

Enum.name: WIDTH_1
Enum.description: Two bit transfer.

Enum.name: WIDTH_2
Enum.description: Four bit transfer.

Enum.name: TXMSK_0
Enum.description: Normal transfer.

Enum.name: TXMSK_1
Enum.description: Mask transmit data.

Enum.name: RXMSK_0
Enum.description: Normal transfer.

Enum.name: RXMSK_1
Enum.description: Receive data is masked.

Enum.name: CONTC_0
Enum.description: Command word for start of new transfer.

Enum.name: CONTC_1
Enum.description: Command word for continuing transfer.

Enum.name: CONT_0
Enum.description: Continuous transfer disabled.

Enum.name: CONT_1
Enum.description: Continuous transfer enabled.

Enum.name: BYSW_0
Enum.description: Byte swap disabled.

Enum.name: BYSW_1
Enum.description: Byte swap enabled.

Enum.name: LSBF_0
Enum.description: Data is transferred MSB first.

Enum.name: LSBF_1
Enum.description: Data is transferred LSB first.

Enum.name: PCS_0
Enum.description: Transfer using LPSPI_PCS[0]

Enum.name: PCS_1
Enum.description: Transfer using LPSPI_PCS[1]

Enum.name: PCS_2
Enum.description: Transfer using LPSPI_PCS[2]

Enum.name: PCS_3
Enum.description: Transfer using LPSPI_PCS[3]

Enum.name: PRESCALE_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Divide by 4.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Divide by 8.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Divide by 16.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Divide by 32.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Divide by 64.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Divide by 128.

Enum.name: CPHA_0
Enum.description: Data is captured on the leading edge of SCK and changed on the following edge.

Enum.name: CPHA_1
Enum.description: Data is changed on the leading edge of SCK and captured on the following edge.

Enum.name: CPOL_0
Enum.description: The inactive state value of SCK is low.

Enum.name: CPOL_1
Enum.description: The inactive state value of SCK is high.

Enum.name: SOF_0
Enum.description: Subsequent data word received after LPSPI_PCS assertion.

Enum.name: SOF_1
Enum.description: First data word received after LPSPI_PCS assertion.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_0
Enum.description: RX FIFO is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_1
Enum.description: RX FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1)

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: SIN is used for input data and SOUT for output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: SIN is used for both input and output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_2
Enum.description: SOUT is used for both input and output data.

Enum.name: PINCFG_3
Enum.description: SOUT is used for input data and SIN for output data.

Enum.name: OUTCFG_0
Enum.description: Output data retains last value when chip select is negated.

Enum.name: OUTCFG_1
Enum.description: Output data is tristated when chip select is negated.

Enum.name: PCSCFG_0

Enum.name: PCSCFG_1
Enum.description: PCS[3:2] are disabled.

BitField.name: GPOLYHU
BitField.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

Enum.name: LDMOD_0

Enum.name: ERR_0
Enum.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.name: ERR_0
Enum.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.name: ERR_0
Enum.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.name: ERR_0
Enum.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.name: ERR_0

Enum.name: ERR_1

When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Enum.name: ERR_1

When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

Register.name: PDB0_DACINTC
Register.description: DAC Interval Trigger n Control register

Enum.name: TOE_0
Enum.description: DAC interval trigger disabled.

Enum.name: TOE_1
Enum.description: DAC interval trigger enabled.

Enum.name: EXT_0
Enum.description: DAC external trigger input disabled. DAC interval counter is reset and started counting when a rising edge is detected on selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SWTRIG is written with 1.

Enum.name: EXT_1
Enum.description: DAC external trigger input enabled. DAC interval counter is bypassed and DAC external trigger input triggers the DAC interval trigger.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_1
Enum.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: FAULTM_0

Enum.name: FAULTM_1
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for even channels only (channels 0, 2, 4, and 6), and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_2
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_3
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the automatic fault clearing.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: FTMEN_0
Enum.description: TPM compatibility. Free running counter and synchronization compatible with TPM.

Enum.name: FTMEN_1
Enum.description: Free running counter and synchronization are different from TPM behavior.

Enum.name: WPDIS_0
Enum.description: Write protection is enabled.

Enum.name: WPDIS_1
Enum.description: Write protection is disabled.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_0
Enum.description: No restrictions. Software and hardware triggers can be used by MOD, CnV, OUTMASK, and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_1
Enum.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_0
Enum.description: Capture test mode is disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_1
Enum.description: Capture test mode is enabled.

Enum.name: FAULTM_0
Enum.description: Fault control is disabled for all channels.

Enum.name: FAULTM_1
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for even channels only (channels 0, 2, 4, and 6), and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_2
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_3
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the automatic fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_0
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_1
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_0
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_1
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_0
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_1
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is enabled.

BitField.name: REINIT
BitField.description: FTM Counter Reinitialization By Synchronization (FTM counter synchronization)

Enum.name: REINIT_0
Enum.description: FTM counter continues to count normally.

Enum.name: REINIT_1
Enum.description: FTM counter is updated with its initial value when the selected trigger is detected.

Enum.name: SYNCHOM_0
Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer in all rising edges of the FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SYNCHOM_1
Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer only by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is disabled.

Enum.name: QUADEN_1
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is enabled.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.description: FTM does not clear the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: FTMEN_0
Enum.description: TPM compatibility. Free running counter and synchronization compatible with TPM.

Enum.name: FTMEN_1
Enum.description: Free running counter and synchronization are different from TPM behavior.

Enum.name: WPDIS_0
Enum.description: Write protection is enabled.

Enum.name: WPDIS_1
Enum.description: Write protection is disabled.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_0
Enum.description: No restrictions. Software and hardware triggers can be used by MOD, CnV, OUTMASK, and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_1
Enum.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_0
Enum.description: Capture test mode is disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_1
Enum.description: Capture test mode is enabled.

Enum.name: FAULTM_0
Enum.description: Fault control is disabled for all channels.

Enum.name: FAULTM_1
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for even channels only (channels 0, 2, 4, and 6), and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_2
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_3
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the automatic fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_0
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_1
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_1
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_0
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_1
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is enabled.

BitField.name: REINIT

Enum.name: REINIT_0
Enum.description: FTM counter continues to count normally.

Enum.name: REINIT_1
Enum.description: FTM counter is updated with its initial value when the selected trigger is detected.

Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer in all rising edges of the FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SYNCHOM_1
Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer only by the PWM synchronization.
