Enum.name: FSTATE_0
Enum.description: FTM outputs will be placed into safe values when fault events in ongoing (defined by POL bits).

Enum.name: FSTATE_1
Enum.description: FTM outputs will be tri-stated when fault event is ongoing

Enum.name: QUADEN_0
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is disabled.

Enum.name: QUADEN_1
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is enabled.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_0
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_1
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_0
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_1
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is enabled.

Enum.name: ITRIGR_0
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated on counter wrap events.

Enum.name: ITRIGR_1
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated when a reload point is reached.

Enum.name: FLT0POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT0POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT1POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT1POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT2POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT2POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT3POL_0
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active high. A 1 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: FLT3POL_1
Enum.description: The fault input polarity is active low. A 0 at the fault input indicates a fault.

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_0
Enum.description: FTM clears the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: HWTRIGMODE_1
Enum.description: FTM does not clear the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

Enum.name: CNTINC_0
Enum.description: CNTIN register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: CNTINC_1
Enum.description: CNTIN register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: INVC_0
Enum.description: INVCTRL register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: INVC_1
Enum.description: INVCTRL register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: SWOC_0
Enum.description: SWOCTRL register is updated with its buffer value at all rising edges of FTM input clock.

Enum.name: SWOC_1
Enum.description: SWOCTRL register is updated with its buffer value by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: SYNCMODE_0
Enum.description: Legacy PWM synchronization is selected.

Enum.name: SYNCMODE_1
Enum.description: Enhanced PWM synchronization is selected.

BitField.name: SWRSTCNT
BitField.description: FTM counter synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

Enum.name: SWRSTCNT_0
Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: SWRSTCNT_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates the FTM counter synchronization.

BitField.name: SWWRBUF
BitField.description: MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

Enum.name: SWWRBUF_0
Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization.

Enum.name: SWWRBUF_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization.

BitField.name: SWOM
BitField.description: Output mask synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

Enum.name: SWOM_0
Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the OUTMASK register synchronization.

Enum.name: SWOM_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates the OUTMASK register synchronization.

BitField.name: SWINVC
BitField.description: Inverting control synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

Enum.name: SWINVC_0
Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the INVCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: SWINVC_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates the INVCTRL register synchronization.

BitField.name: SWSOC
BitField.description: Software output control synchronization is activated by the software trigger.

Enum.name: SWSOC_0
Enum.description: The software trigger does not activate the SWOCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: SWSOC_1
Enum.description: The software trigger activates the SWOCTRL register synchronization.

BitField.name: HWRSTCNT

Enum.name: HWRSTCNT_0
Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate the FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: HWRSTCNT_1
Enum.description: A hardware trigger activates the FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization.

Enum.name: HWWRBUF_1
Enum.description: A hardware trigger activates MOD, HCR, CNTIN, and CV registers synchronization.

BitField.name: HWOM

Enum.name: HWOM_0
Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate the OUTMASK register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWOM_1
Enum.description: A hardware trigger activates the OUTMASK register synchronization.

BitField.name: HWINVC
BitField.description: Inverting control synchronization is activated by a hardware trigger.

Enum.name: HWINVC_0
Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate the INVCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWINVC_1
Enum.description: A hardware trigger activates the INVCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWSOC_0
Enum.description: A hardware trigger does not activate the SWOCTRL register synchronization.

Enum.name: HWSOC_1

Enum.description: Disable channel (n) interrupt. Use software polling.

Enum.name: CHIE_1
Enum.description: Enable channel (n) interrupt.

Enum.name: CHF_0
Enum.description: No channel (n) event has occurred.

Enum.name: CHF_1
Enum.description: A channel (n) event has occurred.

Enum.name: TRIGMODE_0
Enum.description: Channel outputs will generate the normal PWM outputs without generating a pulse.

Enum.name: TRIGMODE_1
Enum.description: If a match in the channel occurs, a trigger generation on channel output will happen. The trigger pulse width has one FTM clock cycle.

Enum.name: CHIS_0
Enum.description: The channel (n) input is zero.

Enum.name: CHIS_1
Enum.description: The channel (n) input is one.

Enum.name: FTMEN_1

Enum.name: WPDIS_0
Enum.description: Write protection is enabled.

Enum.name: WPDIS_1
Enum.description: Write protection is disabled.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_0
Enum.description: No restrictions. Software and hardware triggers can be used by MOD, CnV, OUTMASK, and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: PWMSYNC_1
Enum.description: Software trigger can only be used by MOD and CnV synchronization, and hardware triggers can only be used by OUTMASK and FTM counter synchronization.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_0
Enum.description: Capture test mode is disabled.

Enum.name: CAPTEST_1
Enum.description: Capture test mode is enabled.

Enum.name: FAULTM_0
Enum.description: Fault control is disabled for all channels.

Enum.name: FAULTM_1
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for even channels only (channels 0, 2, 4, and 6), and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_2
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the manual fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTM_3
Enum.description: Fault control is enabled for all channels, and the selected mode is the automatic fault clearing.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_0
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: FAULTIE_1
Enum.description: Fault control interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMIN_1
Enum.description: The minimum loading point is enabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_0
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is disabled.

Enum.name: CNTMAX_1
Enum.description: The maximum loading point is enabled.

Enum.name: REINIT_0
Enum.description: FTM counter continues to count normally.

Enum.name: REINIT_1

Enum.description: OUTMASK register is updated with the value of its buffer only by the PWM synchronization.

Enum.name: QUADEN_1
Enum.description: Quadrature Decoder mode is enabled.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEEN_0

Enum.name: GTBEEN_1
Enum.description: Use of an external global time base is enabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_0
Enum.description: A global time base signal generation is disabled.

Enum.name: GTBEOUT_1

Enum.name: ITRIGR_1
Enum.description: Initialization trigger is generated when a reload point is reached.

Enum.name: ADCH_31
Enum.description: Module is disabled

Enum.name: AIEN_0
Enum.description: Conversion complete interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: AIEN_1
Enum.description: Conversion complete interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: COCO_0
Enum.description: Conversion is not completed.

Enum.name: COCO_1
Enum.description: Conversion is completed.

Enum.name: ADICLK_0
Enum.description: Alternate clock 1 (ADC_ALTCLK1)

Enum.name: ADICLK_1
Enum.description: Alternate clock 2 (ADC_ALTCLK2)

Enum.name: ADICLK_2
Enum.description: Alternate clock 3 (ADC_ALTCLK3)

Enum.name: ADICLK_3
Enum.description: Alternate clock 4 (ADC_ALTCLK4)

Enum.name: MODE_0
Enum.description: 8-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: 12-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_2
Enum.description: 10-bit conversion.

Enum.name: ADIV_0
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 1 and the clock rate is input clock.

Enum.name: ADIV_1
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 2 and the clock rate is (input clock)/2.

Enum.name: ADIV_2
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 4 and the clock rate is (input clock)/4.

Enum.name: ADIV_3
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 8 and the clock rate is (input clock)/8.

Enum.name: REFSEL_0
Enum.description: Default voltage reference pin pair, that is, external pins VREFH and VREFL

Enum.name: REFSEL_1
Enum.description: Alternate reference voltage, that is, VALTH. This voltage may be additional external pin or internal source depending on the MCU configuration. See the chip configuration information for details specific to this MCU.

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA is disabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA is enabled and will assert the ADC DMA request during an ADC conversion complete event , which is indicated when any SC1n[COCO] flag is asserted.

Enum.name: ACFE_0
Enum.description: Compare function disabled.

Enum.name: ACFE_1
Enum.description: Compare function enabled.

Enum.name: ADTRG_0
Enum.description: Software trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADTRG_1
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADACT_0
Enum.description: Conversion not in progress.

Enum.name: ADACT_1
Enum.description: Conversion in progress.

Enum.name: AVGS_0
Enum.description: 4 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_1
Enum.description: 8 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_2
Enum.description: 16 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_3
Enum.description: 32 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGE_0
Enum.description: Hardware average function disabled.

Enum.name: AVGE_1

Enum.name: ADCH_31
Enum.description: Module is disabled

Enum.name: AIEN_0
Enum.description: Conversion complete interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: AIEN_1
Enum.description: Conversion complete interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: COCO_0
Enum.description: Conversion is not completed.

Enum.name: COCO_1
Enum.description: Conversion is completed.

Enum.name: ADICLK_0
Enum.description: Alternate clock 1 (ADC_ALTCLK1)

Enum.name: ADICLK_1
Enum.description: Alternate clock 2 (ADC_ALTCLK2)

Enum.name: ADICLK_2
Enum.description: Alternate clock 3 (ADC_ALTCLK3)

Enum.name: ADICLK_3
Enum.description: Alternate clock 4 (ADC_ALTCLK4)

Enum.name: MODE_0
Enum.description: 8-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: 12-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_2
Enum.description: 10-bit conversion.

Enum.name: ADIV_0
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 1 and the clock rate is input clock.

Enum.name: ADIV_1
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 2 and the clock rate is (input clock)/2.

Enum.name: ADIV_2
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 4 and the clock rate is (input clock)/4.

Enum.name: ADIV_3
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 8 and the clock rate is (input clock)/8.

Enum.name: REFSEL_0
Enum.description: Default voltage reference pin pair, that is, external pins VREFH and VREFL

Enum.name: REFSEL_1
Enum.description: Alternate reference voltage, that is, VALTH. This voltage may be additional external pin or internal source depending on the MCU configuration. See the chip configuration information for details specific to this MCU.

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA is disabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA is enabled and will assert the ADC DMA request during an ADC conversion complete event , which is indicated when any SC1n[COCO] flag is asserted.

Enum.name: ACFE_0
Enum.description: Compare function disabled.

Enum.name: ACFE_1
Enum.description: Compare function enabled.

Enum.name: ADTRG_0
Enum.description: Software trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADTRG_1
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADACT_0
Enum.description: Conversion not in progress.

Enum.name: ADACT_1
Enum.description: Conversion in progress.

Enum.name: AVGS_0
Enum.description: 4 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_1
Enum.description: 8 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_2
Enum.description: 16 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_3
Enum.description: 32 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGE_0
Enum.description: Hardware average function disabled.

Enum.name: AVGE_1
Enum.description: Hardware average function enabled.

Enum.name: ADCO_0
Enum.description: One conversion will be performed (or one set of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

Enum.name: ADCO_1
Enum.description: Continuous conversions will be performed (or continuous sets of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

BitField.name: G
BitField.description: Gain error adjustment factor for the overall conversion

Enum.name: ADCH_31
Enum.description: Module is disabled

Enum.name: AIEN_0
Enum.description: Conversion complete interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: AIEN_1
Enum.description: Conversion complete interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: COCO_0
Enum.description: Conversion is not completed.

Enum.name: COCO_1
Enum.description: Conversion is completed.

Enum.name: ADICLK_0
Enum.description: Alternate clock 1 (ADC_ALTCLK1)

Enum.name: ADICLK_1
Enum.description: Alternate clock 2 (ADC_ALTCLK2)

Enum.name: ADICLK_2
Enum.description: Alternate clock 3 (ADC_ALTCLK3)

Enum.name: ADICLK_3
Enum.description: Alternate clock 4 (ADC_ALTCLK4)

Enum.name: MODE_0
Enum.description: 8-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: 12-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_2
Enum.description: 10-bit conversion.

Enum.name: ADIV_0
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 1 and the clock rate is input clock.

Enum.name: ADIV_1
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 2 and the clock rate is (input clock)/2.

Enum.name: ADIV_2
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 4 and the clock rate is (input clock)/4.

Enum.name: ADIV_3
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 8 and the clock rate is (input clock)/8.

Enum.name: REFSEL_0
Enum.description: Default voltage reference pin pair, that is, external pins VREFH and VREFL

Enum.name: REFSEL_1
Enum.description: Alternate reference voltage, that is, VALTH. This voltage may be additional external pin or internal source depending on the MCU configuration. See the chip configuration information for details specific to this MCU.

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA is disabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA is enabled and will assert the ADC DMA request during an ADC conversion complete event , which is indicated when any SC1n[COCO] flag is asserted.

Enum.name: ACFE_0
Enum.description: Compare function disabled.

Enum.name: ACFE_1
Enum.description: Compare function enabled.

Enum.name: ADTRG_0
Enum.description: Software trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADTRG_1
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADACT_0
Enum.description: Conversion not in progress.

Enum.name: ADACT_1
Enum.description: Conversion in progress.

Enum.name: AVGS_0
Enum.description: 4 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_1
Enum.description: 8 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_2
Enum.description: 16 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_3
Enum.description: 32 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGE_0
Enum.description: Hardware average function disabled.

Enum.name: AVGE_1
Enum.description: Hardware average function enabled.

Enum.name: ADCO_0
Enum.description: One conversion will be performed (or one set of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

Enum.name: ADCO_1
Enum.description: Continuous conversions will be performed (or continuous sets of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

BitField.name: G
BitField.description: Gain error adjustment factor for the overall conversion

Register.name: ADC0_CLPS
Register.description: ADC General Calibration Value Register S

Register.name: ADC0_CLP3
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register 3

Register.name: ADC0_CLP2
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register 2

Register.name: ADC0_CLP1
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register 1

Register.name: ADC0_CLP0
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register 0

Register.name: ADC0_CLPX
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register X

Register.name: ADC0_CLP9
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Value Register 9

Register.name: ADC0_CLPS_OFS
Register.description: ADC General Calibration Offset Value Register S

Register.name: ADC0_CLP3_OFS
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Offset Value Register 3

Register.name: ADC0_CLP2_OFS
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Offset Value Register 2

Register.name: ADC0_CLP1_OFS
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Offset Value Register 1

Register.name: ADC0_CLP0_OFS
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Offset Value Register 0

Register.name: ADC0_CLPX_OFS
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Offset Value Register X

Register.name: ADC0_CLP9_OFS
Register.description: ADC Plus-Side General Calibration Offset Value Register 9

Enum.name: TCR_0
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32768 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_1
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32767 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_127
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32641 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_128
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32896 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_255
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32769 clock cycles.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Resets all RTC registers except for the SWR bit and the RTC_WAR and RTC_RAR registers . The SWR bit is cleared by POR and by software explicitly clearing it.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin is enabled and wakeup pin asserts if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.

Enum.name: NON_SUPPORTED
Enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.

Enum.name: SUPPORTED
Enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are supported.

Enum.name: PROTECTED
Enum.description: Registers cannot be written when locked.

Enum.name: WRITEABLE
Enum.description: Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.

Enum.name: PRESCALER
Enum.description: The prescaler output clock (as configured by TSIC) is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: The RTC 32kHz crystal clock is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: RTC prescaler increments using 32 kHz crystal.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: RTC prescaler increments using LPO, bits [4:0] of the prescaler are bypassed.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is not allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RTC_CLKOUT is disabled.

Enum.name: RTC_PTE0
Enum.description: RTC_CLKOUT is enabled.

Enum.name: VALID
Enum.description: Time is valid.

Enum.name: INVALID
Enum.description: Time is invalid and time counter is read as zero.

Enum.name: NOT_OCCURED
Enum.description: Time overflow has not occurred.

Enum.name: OCCURED
Enum.description: Time overflow has occurred and time counter is read as zero.

Enum.name: NOT_OCCURED
Enum.description: Time alarm has not occurred.

Enum.name: OCCURED
Enum.description: Time alarm has occurred.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time counter is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time counter is enabled.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Time Compensation Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Time Compensation Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Control Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Control Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Status Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Status Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Lock Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Lock Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time invalid flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time invalid flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time overflow flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time overflow flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time alarm flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time alarm flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Seconds interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Seconds interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: If the wakeup pin is enabled, then the wakeup pin will assert.

Enum.name: F1HZ
Enum.description: 1 Hz.

Enum.name: F2HZ
Enum.description: 2 Hz.

Enum.name: F4HZ
Enum.description: 4 Hz.

Enum.name: F8HZ
Enum.description: 8 Hz.

Enum.name: F16HZ
Enum.description: 16 Hz.

Enum.name: F32HZ
Enum.description: 32 Hz.

Enum.name: F64HZ
Enum.description: 64 Hz.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Seconds Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Seconds Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Prescaler Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Prescaler Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Alarm Register are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Writes to the Time Alarm Register complete as normal.

Enum.name: IGNORED

BitField.name: DACBFRPBF
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Position Flag

Enum.name: DACBFRPBF_0
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is not equal to DACBFUP.

Enum.name: DACBFRPBF_1
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is equal to DACBFUP.

BitField.name: DACBFRPTF
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Position Flag

Enum.name: DACBFRPTF_0
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is not zero.

Enum.name: DACBFRPTF_1
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer is zero.

Enum.name: DACBFWMF_0
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer has not reached the watermark level.

Enum.name: DACBFWMF_1
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer has reached the watermark level.

BitField.name: DACBBIEN
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Bottom Flag Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: DACBBIEN_0
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: DACBBIEN_1
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer bottom flag interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: DACBTIEN
BitField.description: DAC Buffer Read Pointer Top Flag Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: DACBTIEN_0
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: DACBTIEN_1
Enum.description: The DAC buffer read pointer top flag interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DACBWIEN_0
Enum.description: The DAC buffer watermark interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: DACBWIEN_1
Enum.description: The DAC buffer watermark interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: LPEN_0
Enum.description: High-Power mode

Enum.name: LPEN_1
Enum.description: Low-Power mode

Enum.name: DACSWTRG_0
Enum.description: The DAC soft trigger is not valid.

Enum.name: DACSWTRG_1
Enum.description: The DAC soft trigger is valid.

Enum.name: DACTRGSEL_0
Enum.description: The DAC hardware trigger is selected.

Enum.name: DACTRGSEL_1
Enum.description: The DAC software trigger is selected.

Enum.name: DACRFS_0
Enum.description: The DAC selects DACREF_1 as the reference voltage.

Enum.name: DACRFS_1
Enum.description: The DAC selects DACREF_2 as the reference voltage.

Enum.name: DACEN_0
Enum.description: The DAC system is disabled.

Enum.name: DACEN_1
Enum.description: The DAC system is enabled.

Enum.name: DACBFEN_0
Enum.description: Buffer read pointer is disabled. The converted data is always the first word of the buffer.

Enum.name: DACBFEN_1
Enum.description: Buffer read pointer is enabled. The converted data is the word that the read pointer points to. It means converted data can be from any word of the buffer.

Enum.name: DACBFMD_0
Enum.description: Normal mode

Enum.name: DACBFMD_1
Enum.description: Swing mode

Enum.name: DACBFMD_2
Enum.description: One-Time Scan mode

Enum.name: DACBFMD_3
Enum.description: FIFO mode

Enum.name: DACBFWM_0
Enum.description: In normal mode, 1 word . In FIFO mode, 2 or less than 2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

Enum.name: DACBFWM_1
Enum.description: In normal mode, 2 words . In FIFO mode, Max/4 or less than Max/4 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

Enum.name: DACBFWM_2
Enum.description: In normal mode, 3 words . In FIFO mode, Max/2 or less than Max/2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit.

Enum.name: DACBFWM_3
Enum.description: In normal mode, 4 words . In FIFO mode, Max-2 or less than Max-2 data remaining in FIFO will set watermark status bit. Max is equal to the FIFO depth.

Enum.name: TESTOUTEN_0
Enum.description: Disable DAC test output

Enum.name: TESTOUTEN_1
Enum.description: Enable DAC test output

Enum.name: BFOUTEN_0
Enum.description: Disable DAC output buffer

Enum.name: BFOUTEN_1
Enum.description: Enable DAC output buffer

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA is disabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA is enabled. When DMA is enabled, the DMA request will be generated by original interrupts. The interrupts will not be presented on this module at the same time.

Register.name: LPTMR0_CSR
Register.description: Low Power Timer Control Status Register

Enum.name: TEN_0
Enum.description: LPTMR is disabled and internal logic is reset.

Enum.name: TEN_1
Enum.description: LPTMR is enabled.

Enum.name: TMS_0
Enum.description: Time Counter mode.

Enum.name: TMS_1
Enum.description: Pulse Counter mode.

Enum.name: TFC_0
Enum.description: CNR is reset whenever TCF is set.

Enum.name: TFC_1
Enum.description: CNR is reset on overflow.

Enum.name: TPP_0
Enum.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-high, and the CNR will increment on the rising-edge.

Enum.name: TPP_1
Enum.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-low, and the CNR will increment on the falling-edge.

Enum.name: TPS_0
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 0 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_1
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 1 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_2
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 2 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_3
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 3 is selected.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Timer interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Timer interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TCF_0
Enum.description: The value of CNR is not equal to CMR and increments.

Enum.name: TCF_1
Enum.description: The value of CNR is equal to CMR and increments.

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Timer DMA Request disabled.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Timer DMA Request enabled.

Enum.name: PCS_0

Enum.name: PCS_3

Enum.name: PBYP_1
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter is bypassed.

Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2; glitch filter does not support this configuration.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 64; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 128; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 64 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 256; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 128 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_8
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 512; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 256 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_9
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 1024; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 512 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_10
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2048; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 1024 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_11
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4096; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2048 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_12
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8192; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4096 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_13
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16,384; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8192 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_14
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32,768; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16,384 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_15
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 65,536; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32,768 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: NOT_LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are locked and cannot be updated until the next system reset.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.name: DMA_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.description: Pin disabled (Alternative 0) (analog).

Enum.name: NOT_LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are locked and cannot be updated until the next system reset.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: DMA_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on rising edge.

Enum.name: DMA_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on falling edge.

Enum.name: DMA_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and DMA request on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: BUS
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the bus clock.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the LPO clock.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: BUS
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the bus clock.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the LPO clock.

Enum.name: STOP_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: DBG_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: DBG_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: TST_0
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode disabled.

Enum.name: TST_1
Enum.description: Watchdog user mode enabled. (Watchdog test mode disabled.) After testing the watchdog, software should use this setting to indicate that the watchdog is functioning normally in user mode.

Enum.name: TST_2
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the low byte is used. CNT[CNTLOW] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALLOW].

Enum.name: TST_3
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the high byte is used. CNT[CNTHIGH] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALHIGH].

Enum.name: UPDATE_0
Enum.description: Updates not allowed. After the initial configuration, the watchdog cannot be later modified without forcing a reset.

Enum.name: UPDATE_1
Enum.description: Updates allowed. Software can modify the watchdog configuration registers within 128 bus clocks after performing the unlock write sequence.

Enum.name: INT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are disabled. Watchdog resets are not delayed.

Enum.name: INT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are enabled. Watchdog resets are delayed by 128 bus clocks from the interrupt vector fetch.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled.

Enum.name: CLK_0
Enum.description: Bus clock

Enum.name: CLK_1
Enum.description: LPO clock

Enum.name: CLK_2
Enum.description: System oscillator clock (SOSC, from SCG)

Enum.name: CLK_3
Enum.description: Slow internal reference clock (SIRC, from SCG)

Enum.name: RCS_0
Enum.description: Reconfiguring WDOG.

Enum.name: RCS_1
Enum.description: Reconfiguration is successful.

Enum.name: ULK_0
Enum.description: WDOG is locked.

Enum.name: ULK_1
Enum.description: WDOG is unlocked.

Enum.name: PRES_0
Enum.description: 256 prescaler disabled.

Enum.name: PRES_1
Enum.description: 256 prescaler enabled.

BitField.name: CMD32EN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

Enum.name: CMD32EN_0
Enum.description: Disables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. Only 16-bit or 8-bit is supported.

Enum.name: CMD32EN_1
Enum.description: Enables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. 16-bit or 8-bit is NOT supported.

Enum.name: FLG_0
Enum.description: No interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: FLG_1
Enum.description: An interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: WIN_0
Enum.description: Window mode disabled.

Enum.name: WIN_1
Enum.description: Window mode enabled.

BitField.name: CNTLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: CNTHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the timeout value

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the timeout value

Register.name: PWT_CS
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Control and Status Register

Enum.name: PWTOV_0
Enum.description: PWT counter no overflow.

Enum.name: PWTOV_1
Enum.description: PWT counter runs from 0xFFFF to 0x0000.

Enum.name: PWTRDY_0
Enum.description: PWT pulse width register(s) is not up-to-date.

Enum.name: PWTRDY_1
Enum.description: PWT pulse width register(s) has been updated.

BitField.name: FCTLE
BitField.description: First counter load enable after enable

Enum.name: FCTLE_0
Enum.description: Do not load the first counter values to corresponding registers

Enum.name: FCTLE_1
Enum.description: Load the first coutner value to corresponding registers depended by the PWTIN level

Enum.name: PWTSR_0
Enum.description: No action taken.

Enum.name: PWTSR_1
Enum.description: Writing 1 to this field will perform soft reset to PWT.

Enum.name: POVIE_0
Enum.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

Enum.name: POVIE_1
Enum.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

BitField.name: PRDYIE
BitField.description: PWT Pulse Width Data Ready Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: PRDYIE_0
Enum.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

Enum.name: PRDYIE_1
Enum.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

Enum.name: PWTIE_0
Enum.description: Disables the PWT to generate interrupt.

Enum.name: PWTIE_1
Enum.description: Enables the PWT to generate interrupt.

Enum.name: PWTEN_0
Enum.description: The PWT is disabled.

Enum.name: PWTEN_1
Enum.description: The PWT is enabled.

Enum.name: PRE_0
Enum.description: Clock divided by 1.

Enum.name: PRE_1
Enum.description: Clock divided by 2.

Enum.name: PRE_2
Enum.description: Clock divided by 4.

Enum.name: PRE_3
Enum.description: Clock divided by 8.

Enum.name: PRE_4
Enum.description: Clock divided by 16.

Enum.name: PRE_5
Enum.description: Clock divided by 32.

Enum.name: PRE_6
Enum.description: Clock divided by 64.

Enum.name: PRE_7
Enum.description: Clock divided by 128.

BitField.name: TGL
BitField.description: PWTIN states Toggled from last state

Enum.name: TGL_0
Enum.description: The selected PWTIN hasn't changed its original states from last time.

Enum.name: TGL_1
Enum.description: The selected PWTIN has toggled its states.

Enum.name: PINSEL_0
Enum.description: PWTIN[0] is enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_1
Enum.description: PWTIN[1] is enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_2
Enum.description: PWTIN[2] enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: FLEXIO
RegisterGroup.description: Flexible I/O - universal I/O module for communication (UART, SPI, I2C, I2S) and PWM purposes.

Enum.name: FEATURE_0
Enum.description: Standard features implemented.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Supports state, logic and parallel modes.

Enum.name: FLEXEN_0
Enum.description: FlexIO module is disabled.

Enum.name: FLEXEN_1
Enum.description: FlexIO module is enabled.

Enum.name: SWRST_0
Enum.description: Software reset is disabled

Enum.name: SWRST_1
Enum.description: Software reset is enabled, all FlexIO registers except the Control Register are reset.

Enum.name: FASTACC_0
Enum.description: Configures for normal register accesses to FlexIO

Enum.name: FASTACC_1
Enum.description: Configures for fast register accesses to FlexIO

Enum.name: DBGE_0
Enum.description: FlexIO is disabled in debug modes.

Enum.name: DBGE_1
Enum.description: FlexIO is enabled in debug modes

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: FlexIO enabled in Doze modes.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: FlexIO disabled in Doze modes.

Enum.name: SSF_0
Enum.description: Status flag is clear

Enum.name: SSF_1
Enum.description: Status flag is set

Enum.name: SEF_0
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag is clear

Enum.name: SEF_1
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag is set

Enum.name: TSF_0
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag is clear

Enum.name: TSF_1
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag is set

Enum.name: SSIE_0
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag interrupt disabled

Enum.name: SSIE_1
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SEIE_0
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag interrupt disabled

Enum.name: SEIE_1
Enum.description: Shifter Error Flag interrupt enabled

Enum.name: TEIE_0
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag interrupt is disabled

Enum.name: TEIE_1
Enum.description: Timer Status Flag interrupt is enabled

Enum.name: SSDE_0
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag DMA request is disabled

Enum.name: SSDE_1
Enum.description: Shifter Status Flag DMA request is enabled

Enum.name: SMOD_1
Enum.description: Receive mode. Captures the current Shifter content into the SHIFTBUF on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_2
Enum.description: Transmit mode. Load SHIFTBUF contents into the Shifter on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_4
Enum.description: Match Store mode. Shifter data is compared to SHIFTBUF content on expiration of the Timer.

Enum.name: SMOD_5
Enum.description: Match Continuous mode. Shifter data is continuously compared to SHIFTBUF contents.

Enum.name: SSTOP_0
Enum.description: Stop bit disabled for transmitter/receiver/match store

Enum.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 0 on store, receiver/match store sets error flag if stop bit is not 0

Enum.name: SSTOP_3
Enum.description: Transmitter outputs stop bit value 1 on store, receiver/match store sets error flag if stop bit is not 1

Enum.description: Decrement counter on Pin input (both edges), Shift clock equals Pin input.

Enum.name: TIMDEC_3
Enum.description: Decrement counter on Trigger input (both edges), Shift clock equals Trigger input.

Enum.name: TIMOUT_0
Enum.description: Timer output is logic one when enabled and is not affected by timer reset

Enum.name: TIMOUT_1
Enum.description: Timer output is logic zero when enabled and is not affected by timer reset

Enum.name: TIMOUT_2
Enum.description: Timer output is logic one when enabled and on timer reset

Enum.name: TIMOUT_3
Enum.description: Timer output is logic zero when enabled and on timer reset

BitField.name: ROSCEREFS
BitField.description: RTC 32k Oscillator external reference clcok selection

Enum.name: EXTERNAL
Enum.description: Bypass mode. RTC oscillator selects the external 32k clock.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: Crystal mode.

Enum.name: STABLE
Enum.description: RTC 32k oscillator is unstable now and no clock will go out of the block.

Enum.name: UNSTABLE
Enum.description: RTC 32k oscillator is stable.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is disabled regardless the state of ROSCEN.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is enabled in Stop mode when ROSCEN is set.

Enum.name: DISABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLE
Enum.description: Oscillator is enabled.

BitField.name: SERVICE
BitField.description: The EWM refresh mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

BitField.name: COMPAREL
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum refresh time is required

BitField.name: COMPAREH
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum refresh time is required

BitField.name: CLK_DIV
BitField.description: Selected low power clock source for running the EWM counter can be prescaled as below

Enum.name: FEATURE_2
Enum.description: Master only with standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Master and slave with standard feature set.

Enum.name: MEN_0
Enum.description: Master logic is disabled.

Enum.name: MEN_1
Enum.description: Master logic is enabled.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Master logic is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Master logic is reset.

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: Master is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: Master is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: Master is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: Master is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: RTF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RTF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: RRF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RRF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: TDF_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not requested.

Enum.name: TDF_1
Enum.description: Transmit data is requested.

Enum.name: RDF_0
Enum.description: Receive Data is not ready.

Enum.name: RDF_1
Enum.description: Receive data is ready.

Enum.name: EPF_0
Enum.description: Master has not generated a STOP or Repeated START condition.

Enum.name: EPF_1
Enum.description: Master has generated a STOP or Repeated START condition.

Enum.name: SDF_0
Enum.description: Master has not generated a STOP condition.

Enum.name: SDF_1
Enum.description: Master has generated a STOP condition.

Enum.name: NDF_0
Enum.description: Unexpected NACK not detected.

Enum.name: NDF_1
Enum.description: Unexpected NACK was detected.

Enum.name: ALF_0
Enum.description: Master has not lost arbitration.

Enum.name: ALF_1
Enum.description: Master has lost arbitration.

Enum.name: FEF_0
Enum.description: No error.

Enum.name: FEF_1
Enum.description: Master sending or receiving data without START condition.

Enum.name: PLTF_0
Enum.description: Pin low timeout has not occurred or is disabled.

Enum.name: PLTF_1
Enum.description: Pin low timeout has occurred.

Enum.name: DMF_0
Enum.description: Have not received matching data.

Enum.name: DMF_1
Enum.description: Have received matching data.

Enum.name: MBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Master is idle.

Enum.name: MBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Master is busy.

Enum.name: BBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Bus is idle.

Enum.name: BBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Bus is busy.

Enum.name: TDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled

Enum.name: RDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: EPIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: EPIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: SDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: SDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: NDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: NDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: ALIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: ALIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: PLTIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: PLTIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: HREN_0
Enum.description: Host request input is disabled.

Enum.name: HREN_1
Enum.description: Host request input is enabled.

Enum.name: HRPOL_0
Enum.description: Active low.

Enum.name: HRPOL_1
Enum.description: Active high.

Enum.name: HRSEL_0
Enum.description: Host request input is pin LPI2C_HREQ.

Enum.name: HRSEL_1
Enum.description: Host request input is input trigger.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_0
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is disabled.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_1
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is enabled.

Enum.name: RDMO_0
Enum.description: Received data is stored in the receive FIFO as normal.

Enum.name: RDMO_1
Enum.description: Received data is discarded unless the RMF is set.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Divide by 4.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Divide by 8.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Divide by 16.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Divide by 32.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Divide by 64.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Divide by 128.

Enum.name: AUTOSTOP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: AUTOSTOP_1
Enum.description: STOP condition is automatically generated whenever the transmit FIFO is empty and LPI2C master is busy.

BitField.name: IGNACK
BitField.description: When set, the received NACK field is ignored and assumed to be ACK

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will receive ACK and NACK normally.

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will treat a received NACK as if it was an ACK.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_0
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if SCL is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_1
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if either SCL or SDA is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match disabled.

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin open drain mode.

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode).

Enum.name: PINCFG_2
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin push-pull mode.

Enum.name: PINCFG_3
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 4-pin push-pull mode.

BitField.name: IGNACK
BitField.description: When set, the received NACK field is ignored and assumed to be ACK

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will receive ACK and NACK normally.

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will treat a received NACK as if it was an ACK.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_0
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if SCL is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_1
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if either SCL or SDA is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match disabled.

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).
