Enum.name: TXNACK_0
Enum.description: Transmit ACK for received word.

Enum.name: TXNACK_1
Enum.description: Transmit NACK for received word.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_0
Enum.description: The Receive Data Register is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_1
Enum.description: The Receive Data Register is empty.

Enum.name: SOF_0
Enum.description: Indicates this is not the first data word since a (repeated) START or STOP condition.

Enum.name: SOF_1
Enum.description: Indicates this is the first data word since a (repeated) START or STOP condition.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support)

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1. (Legacy support).

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: RIDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RIDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDMAE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Analog Comparator is disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1

Enum.name: OPE_0
Enum.description: When OPE is 0, the comparator output (after window/filter settings dependent on software configuration) is not available to a packaged pin.

Enum.name: OPE_1
Enum.description: When OPE is 1, and if the software has configured the comparator to own a packaged pin, the comparator is available in a packaged pin.

Enum.name: COS_0
Enum.description: Set CMPO to equal COUT (filtered comparator output).

Enum.description: Does not invert the comparator output.

Enum.name: INVT_1
Enum.description: Inverts the comparator output.

Enum.name: WE_0

Enum.name: WE_1
Enum.description: Windowing mode is selected.

Enum.description: The sampling takes place 2 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_3
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 3 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.description: The Minus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Plus port are swept in each round.

Enum.name: RRIE_0
Enum.description: The round-robin interrupt is disabled.

Register.name: PMC_LVDSC1
Register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 1 Register

Enum.name: LVDRE_0
Enum.description: No system resets on low voltage detect events.

Enum.name: LVDRE_1
Enum.description: If the supply voltage falls below VLVD, a system reset will be generated.

Enum.name: LVDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

Enum.name: LVDIE_1
Enum.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVDF = 1

Enum.name: LVDF_0
Enum.description: Low-voltage event not detected

Enum.name: LVDF_1
Enum.description: Low-voltage event detected

Register.name: PMC_LVDSC2
Register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 2 Register

Enum.name: LVWIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

Enum.name: LVWIE_1
Enum.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVWF=1

Enum.name: LVWF_0
Enum.description: Low-voltage warning event not detected

Enum.name: LVWF_1
Enum.description: Low-voltage warning event detected

Enum.name: BIASEN_0
Enum.description: Biasing disabled, core logic can run in full performance

Enum.name: BIASEN_1
Enum.description: Biasing enabled, core logic is slower and there are restrictions in allowed system clock speed (see Data Sheet for details)

Enum.name: CLKBIASDIS_0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: CLKBIASDIS_1
Enum.description: In STOP or VLPS mode the bias currents and reference voltages for the following clock modules are disabled: SIRC, FIRC, PLL. (if available on device)

BitField.name: REGFPM
BitField.description: Regulator in Full Performance Mode Status Bit

Enum.name: REGFPM_0
Enum.description: Regulator is in low power mode or transition to/from

Enum.name: REGFPM_1
Enum.description: Regulator is in full performance mode

Enum.name: LPOSTAT_0
Enum.description: Low power oscillator in low phase

Enum.name: LPOSTAT_1
Enum.description: Low power oscillator in high phase

Enum.name: LPODIS_0
Enum.description: Low power oscillator enabled

Enum.name: LPODIS_1
Enum.description: Low power oscillator disabled

Enum.name: FEATURE_0
Enum.description: Standard features implemented

Enum.name: EHSRUN_0
Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: EHSRUN_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: ELLS_0
Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: ELLS_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: ELLS2_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: EVLLS0_0

Enum.name: EVLLS0_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: AVLP_0

Enum.name: AVLP_1
Enum.description: VLPR, VLPW, and VLPS are allowed.

Enum.name: AHSRUN_0
Enum.description: HSRUN is not allowed

Enum.name: AHSRUN_1
Enum.description: HSRUN is allowed

Enum.name: STOPM_0
Enum.description: Normal Stop (STOP)

Enum.name: STOPM_2
Enum.description: Very-Low-Power Stop (VLPS)

Enum.name: STOPA_0
Enum.description: The previous stop mode entry was successful.

Enum.name: STOPA_1
Enum.description: The previous stop mode entry was aborted.

Enum.name: RUNM_0
Enum.description: Normal Run mode (RUN)

Enum.name: RUNM_2
Enum.description: Very-Low-Power Run mode (VLPR)

Enum.name: RUNM_3
Enum.description: High Speed Run mode (HSRUN)

Enum.name: PSTOPO_0
Enum.description: STOP - Normal Stop mode

Enum.name: PSTOPO_1
Enum.description: PSTOP1 - Partial Stop with both system and bus clocks disabled

Enum.name: PSTOPO_2
Enum.description: PSTOP2 - Partial Stop with system clock disabled and bus clock enabled

Enum.description: Standard feature set.

BitField.name: LVD
BitField.description: Low-Voltage Detect Reset or High-Voltage Detect Reset

Enum.name: LVD_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by LVD trip, HVD trip or POR

Enum.name: LVD_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by LVD trip, HVD trip or POR

Enum.name: LOC_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by a loss of external clock.

Enum.name: LOC_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by a loss of external clock.

Enum.name: LOL_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by a loss of lock in the PLL/FLL

Enum.name: LOL_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by a loss of lock in the PLL/FLL

Enum.name: WDOG_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by watchdog timeout

Enum.name: WDOG_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by watchdog timeout

Enum.name: PIN_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by external reset pin

Enum.name: PIN_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by external reset pin

Enum.name: POR_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by POR

Enum.name: POR_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by POR

Enum.name: JTAG_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by JTAG

Enum.name: JTAG_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by JTAG

Enum.name: LOCKUP_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by core LOCKUP event

Enum.name: LOCKUP_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by core LOCKUP event

Enum.name: SW_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

Enum.name: SW_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by software setting of SYSRESETREQ bit

Enum.name: MDM_AP_0
Enum.description: Reset was not caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

Enum.name: MDM_AP_1
Enum.description: Reset was caused by host debugger system setting of the System Reset Request bit

Enum.name: SACKERR_0
Enum.description: Reset not caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

Enum.name: SACKERR_1
Enum.description: Reset caused by peripheral failure to acknowledge attempt to enter stop mode

BitField.name: RSTFLTSRW
BitField.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Run and Wait Modes

Enum.name: RSTFLTSRW_0
Enum.description: All filtering disabled

Enum.name: RSTFLTSRW_1
Enum.description: Bus clock filter enabled for normal operation

Enum.name: RSTFLTSRW_2
Enum.description: LPO clock filter enabled for normal operation

BitField.name: RSTFLTSS
BitField.description: Reset Pin Filter Select in Stop Mode

Enum.name: RSTFLTSS_0
Enum.description: All filtering disabled

Enum.name: RSTFLTSS_1
Enum.description: LPO clock filter enabled

BitField.name: RSTFLTSEL
BitField.description: Reset Pin Filter Bus Clock Select

Enum.name: BOOTROM_0
Enum.description: Boot from Flash

Enum.name: BOOTROM_1
Enum.description: Boot from ROM due to BOOTCFG0 pin assertion / Reserved if no Boot pin

Enum.name: BOOTROM_2
Enum.description: Boot form ROM due to FOPT[7] configuration

Enum.name: BOOTROM_3
Enum.description: Boot from ROM due to both BOOTCFG0 pin assertion and FOPT[7] configuration

Enum.name: FORCEROM_0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: FORCEROM_1
Enum.description: Force boot from ROM with RCM_MR[1] set.

Enum.name: FORCEROM_2
Enum.description: Force boot from ROM with RCM_MR[2] set.

Enum.name: FORCEROM_3
Enum.description: Force boot from ROM with RCM_MR[2:1] set.
