BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

Enum.name: RETTOBASE_0
Enum.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute

Enum.name: RETTOBASE_1
Enum.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.name: ISRPREEMPT_0
Enum.description: Will not service

Enum.name: ISRPREEMPT_1
Enum.description: Will service a pending exception

Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_0
Enum.description: no effect

Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_1
Enum.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

Enum.name: PENDSTSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

Enum.name: PENDSTSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_0
Enum.description: no effect

Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_1
Enum.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

Enum.name: PENDSVSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

Enum.name: PENDSVSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_0
Enum.description: no system reset request

Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_1
Enum.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0
Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1
Enum.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

Enum.name: SLEEPDEEP_1
Enum.description: deep sleep

Enum.name: SEVONPEND_0
Enum.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

Enum.name: SEVONPEND_1
Enum.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

Enum.name: NONBASETHRDENA_0
Enum.description: processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active

Enum.name: NONBASETHRDENA_1
Enum.description: processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

Enum.name: UNALIGN_TRP_0
Enum.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

Enum.name: UNALIGN_TRP_1
Enum.description: trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

Enum.name: DIV_0_TRP_0
Enum.description: do not trap divide by 0

Enum.name: DIV_0_TRP_1
Enum.description: trap divide by 0

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

Enum.name: BFHFNMIGN_0
Enum.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up

Enum.name: BFHFNMIGN_1
Enum.description: handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Enum.name: STKALIGN_0
Enum.description: 4-byte aligned

Enum.name: STKALIGN_1
Enum.description: 8-byte aligned

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.name: SCB_SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

Enum.name: MEMFAULTACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: MEMFAULTACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: BUSFAULTACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: BUSFAULTACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: USGFAULTACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: USGFAULTACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: SVCALLACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: SVCALLACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: MONITORACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: MONITORACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: PENDSVACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: PENDSVACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: SYSTICKACT_0
Enum.description: exception is not active

Enum.name: SYSTICKACT_1
Enum.description: exception is active

Enum.name: USGFAULTPENDED_0
Enum.description: exception is not pending

Enum.name: USGFAULTPENDED_1
Enum.description: exception is pending

Enum.name: MEMFAULTPENDED_0
Enum.description: exception is not pending

Enum.name: MEMFAULTPENDED_1
Enum.description: exception is pending

Enum.name: BUSFAULTPENDED_0
Enum.description: exception is not pending

Enum.name: BUSFAULTPENDED_1
Enum.description: exception is pending

Enum.name: SVCALLPENDED_0
Enum.description: exception is not pending

Enum.name: SVCALLPENDED_1
Enum.description: exception is pending

Enum.name: MEMFAULTENA_0
Enum.description: disable the exception

Enum.name: MEMFAULTENA_1
Enum.description: enable the exception

Enum.name: BUSFAULTENA_0
Enum.description: disable the exception

Enum.name: BUSFAULTENA_1
Enum.description: enable the exception

Enum.name: USGFAULTENA_0
Enum.description: disable the exception

Enum.name: USGFAULTENA_1
Enum.description: enable the exception

Enum.name: IACCVIOL_0
Enum.description: no instruction access violation fault

Enum.name: IACCVIOL_1
Enum.description: the processor attempted an instruction fetch from a location that does not permit execution

Enum.name: DACCVIOL_0
Enum.description: no data access violation fault

Enum.name: DACCVIOL_1
Enum.description: the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation

Enum.name: MUNSTKERR_0
Enum.description: no unstacking fault

Enum.name: MUNSTKERR_1
Enum.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more access violations

Enum.name: MSTKERR_0
Enum.description: no stacking fault

Enum.name: MSTKERR_1
Enum.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more access violations

Enum.name: MLSPERR_0
Enum.description: No MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

Enum.name: MLSPERR_1
Enum.description: A MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

Enum.name: MMARVALID_0
Enum.description: value in MMAR is not a valid fault address

Enum.name: MMARVALID_1
Enum.description: MMAR holds a valid fault address

Enum.name: IBUSERR_0
Enum.description: no instruction bus error

Enum.name: IBUSERR_1
Enum.description: instruction bus error

Enum.name: PRECISERR_0
Enum.description: no precise data bus error

Enum.name: PRECISERR_1
Enum.description: a data bus error has occurred, and the PC value stacked for the exception return points to the instruction that caused the fault

Enum.name: IMPRECISERR_0
Enum.description: no imprecise data bus error

Enum.name: IMPRECISERR_1
Enum.description: a data bus error has occurred, but the return address in the stack frame is not related to the instruction that caused the error

Enum.name: UNSTKERR_0
Enum.description: no unstacking fault

Enum.name: UNSTKERR_1
Enum.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more BusFaults

Enum.name: STKERR_0
Enum.description: no stacking fault

Enum.name: STKERR_1
Enum.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more BusFaults

Enum.name: LSPERR_0
Enum.description: No bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

Enum.name: LSPERR_1
Enum.description: A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

Enum.name: BFARVALID_0
Enum.description: value in BFAR is not a valid fault address

Enum.name: BFARVALID_1
Enum.description: BFAR holds a valid fault address

Enum.name: UNDEFINSTR_0
Enum.description: no undefined instruction UsageFault

Enum.name: UNDEFINSTR_1
Enum.description: the processor has attempted to execute an undefined instruction

Enum.name: INVSTATE_0
Enum.description: no invalid state UsageFault

Enum.name: INVSTATE_1
Enum.description: the processor has attempted to execute an instruction that makes illegal use of the EPSR

Enum.name: INVPC_0
Enum.description: no invalid PC load UsageFault

Enum.name: INVPC_1
Enum.description: the processor has attempted an illegal load of EXC_RETURN to the PC

Enum.name: NOCP_0
Enum.description: no UsageFault caused by attempting to access a coprocessor

Enum.name: NOCP_1
Enum.description: the processor has attempted to access a coprocessor

Enum.name: UNALIGNED_0
Enum.description: no unaligned access fault, or unaligned access trapping not enabled

Enum.name: UNALIGNED_1
Enum.description: the processor has made an unaligned memory access

Enum.name: DIVBYZERO_0
Enum.description: no divide by zero fault, or divide by zero trapping not enabled

Enum.name: DIVBYZERO_1
Enum.description: the processor has executed an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

Enum.name: VECTTBL_0
Enum.description: no BusFault on vector table read

Enum.name: VECTTBL_1
Enum.description: BusFault on vector table read

Enum.name: FORCED_0
Enum.description: no forced HardFault

Enum.name: FORCED_1
Enum.description: forced HardFault

Enum.name: HALTED_0
Enum.description: No active halt request debug event

Enum.name: HALTED_1
Enum.description: Halt request debug event active

Enum.name: BKPT_0
Enum.description: No current breakpoint debug event

Enum.name: BKPT_1
Enum.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

Enum.name: DWTTRAP_0
Enum.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

Enum.name: DWTTRAP_1
Enum.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

Enum.name: VCATCH_0
Enum.description: No Vector catch triggered

Enum.name: VCATCH_1
Enum.description: Vector catch triggered

Enum.name: EXTERNAL_0
Enum.description: No EDBGRQ debug event

Enum.name: EXTERNAL_1
Enum.description: EDBGRQ debug event

BitField.name: AUXFAULT
BitField.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

Enum.name: CP10_0
Enum.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

Enum.name: CP10_1
Enum.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.

Enum.name: CP10_3
Enum.description: Full access.

Enum.name: CP11_0
Enum.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

Enum.name: CP11_1
Enum.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.

Enum.name: CP11_3
Enum.description: Full access.

Enum.name: LSPACT_0
Enum.description: Lazy state preservation is not active.

Enum.name: LSPACT_1
Enum.description: Lazy state preservation is active. floating-point stack frame has been allocated but saving state to it has been deferred.

BitField.name: USER
BitField.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: USER_0
Enum.description: Privilege level was not user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: USER_1
Enum.description: Privilege level was user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: THREAD
BitField.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: THREAD_0
Enum.description: Mode was not Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: THREAD_1
Enum.description: Mode was Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: HFRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: HFRDY_0
Enum.description: Priority did not permit setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: HFRDY_1
Enum.description: Priority permitted setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: MMRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: MMRDY_0
Enum.description: MemManage is disabled or priority did not permit setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: MMRDY_1
Enum.description: MemManage is enabled and priority permitted setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: BFRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: BFRDY_0
Enum.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: BFRDY_1
Enum.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: MONRDY
BitField.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: MONRDY_0
Enum.description: DebugMonitor is disabled or priority did not permit setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

Enum.name: MONRDY_1
Enum.description: DebugMonitor is enabled and priority permits setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

BitField.name: LSPEN
BitField.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

Enum.name: LSPEN_0
Enum.description: Disable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

Enum.name: LSPEN_1
Enum.description: Enable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

BitField.name: ASPEN
BitField.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit.

Enum.name: ASPEN_0
Enum.description: Disable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

Enum.name: ASPEN_1
Enum.description: Enable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame.

BitField.name: RMode
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field).

Enum.name: RMode_0
Enum.description: Round to Nearest (RN) mode

Enum.name: RMode_1
Enum.description: Round towards Plus Infinity (RP) mode.

Enum.name: RMode_2
Enum.description: Round towards Minus Infinity (RM) mode.

Enum.name: RMode_3
Enum.description: Round towards Zero (RZ) mode.

BitField.name: FZ
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit).

Enum.name: FZ_0
Enum.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard.

Enum.name: FZ_1
Enum.description: Flush-to-zero mode enabled.

BitField.name: DN
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit).

Enum.name: DN_0
Enum.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation.

Enum.name: DN_1
Enum.description: Any operation involving one or more NaNs returns the Default NaN.

BitField.name: AHP
BitField.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit).

Enum.name: AHP_0
Enum.description: IEEE half-precision format selected.

Enum.name: AHP_1
Enum.description: Alternative half-precision format selected.

Enum.name: ENABLE_0
Enum.description: counter disabled

Enum.name: ENABLE_1
Enum.description: counter enabled

Enum.name: TICKINT_0
Enum.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: TICKINT_1
Enum.description: counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: CLKSOURCE_0
Enum.description: external clock

Enum.name: CLKSOURCE_1
Enum.description: processor clock

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

Enum.name: SKEW_0
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is exact

Enum.name: SKEW_1
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

Enum.name: NOREF_0
Enum.description: The reference clock is provided

Enum.name: NOREF_1
Enum.description: The reference clock is not provided

BitField.name: INTID
BitField.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.

Register.name: DHCSR_Read
Register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

BitField.name: C_DEBUGEN
BitField.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

BitField.name: C_HALT
BitField.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_HALT_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_HALT_1
Enum.description: Halt the processor.

BitField.name: C_STEP
BitField.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_STEP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: C_MASKINTS
BitField.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_0
Enum.description: Do not mask.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_1
Enum.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

BitField.name: C_SNAPSTALL
BitField.description: C_SNAPSTALL bit. If the processor is stalled on a load or store operation, a debugger can set this bit to 1 to attempt to break the stall. The effect of setting this bit to 1 is UNPREDICTABLE unless the DHCSR write also sets C_DEBUGEN and C_HALT to 1.This means that if the processor is not already in Debug statea it enters Debug state when the stalled instruction completes.Writing 1 to this bit makes the state of the memory system UNPREDICTABLE. Therefore, if a debugger writes 1 to this bit it must reset the processor before leaving Debug state.A Power-on reset sets this bit to 0.

Enum.name: C_SNAPSTALL_0
Enum.description: No action.

Enum.name: C_SNAPSTALL_1
Enum.description: Attempt to force any stalled load or store instruction to complete.

BitField.name: S_REGRDY
BitField.description: S_REGRDY bit. A handshake flag for transfers through the DCRDR:- Writing to DCRSR clears the bit to 0.- Completion of the DCRDR transfer then sets the bit to 1.This bit is valid only when the processor is in Debug state, otherwise the bit is UNKNOWN.

Enum.name: S_REGRDY_0
Enum.description: There has been a write to the DCRDR, but the transfer is not complete.

Enum.name: S_REGRDY_1
Enum.description: The transfer to or from the DCRDR is complete.

BitField.name: S_HALT
BitField.description: S_HALT bit. Indicates whether the processor is in Debug state.

Enum.name: S_HALT_0
Enum.description: Not in Debug state.

Enum.name: S_HALT_1
Enum.description: In Debug state.

BitField.name: S_SLEEP
BitField.description: S_SLEEP bit. Indicates whether the processor is sleeping.The debugger must set the C_HALT bit to 1 to gain control, or wait for an interrupt or other wakeup event to wakeup the system.

Enum.name: S_SLEEP_0
Enum.description: Not sleeping.

BitField.name: S_LOCKUP
BitField.description: S_LOCKUP bit. Indicates whether the processor is locked up because of an unrecoverable exception.This bit can only be read as 1 by a remote debugger, using the DAP. The value of 1 indicates that the processor is running but locked up.The bit clears to 0 when the processor enters Debug state.

Enum.name: S_LOCKUP_0
Enum.description: Not locked up

Enum.name: S_LOCKUP_1
Enum.description: Locked up

BitField.name: S_RETIRE_ST
BitField.description: S_RETIRE_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has completed the execution of an instruction since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.A debugger can check this bit to determine if the processor is stalled on a load, store or fetch access.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on or Local reset, but then is set to 1 as soon as the processor executes and retires an instruction.

Enum.name: S_RETIRE_ST_0
Enum.description: No instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

Enum.name: S_RETIRE_ST_1
Enum.description: At least one instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

BitField.name: S_RESET_ST
BitField.description: S_RESET_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has been reset since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.

Enum.name: S_RESET_ST_0
Enum.description: No reset since last DHCSR read.

Enum.name: S_RESET_ST_1
Enum.description: At least one reset since last DHCSR read.

Register.name: DHCSR_Write
Register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

BitField.name: C_DEBUGEN
BitField.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

BitField.name: C_HALT
BitField.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_HALT_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_HALT_1
Enum.description: Halt the processor.

BitField.name: C_STEP
BitField.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_STEP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: C_MASKINTS
BitField.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_0
Enum.description: Do not mask.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_1
Enum.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

BitField.name: C_SNAPSTALL
BitField.description: C_SNAPSTALL bit. If the processor is stalled on a load or store operation, a debugger can set this bit to 1 to attempt to break the stall. The effect of setting this bit to 1 is UNPREDICTABLE unless the DHCSR write also sets C_DEBUGEN and C_HALT to 1.This means that if the processor is not already in Debug statea it enters Debug state when the stalled instruction completes.Writing 1 to this bit makes the state of the memory system UNPREDICTABLE. Therefore, if a debugger writes 1 to this bit it must reset the processor before leaving Debug state.A Power-on reset sets this bit to 0.

Enum.name: C_SNAPSTALL_0
Enum.description: No action.

Enum.name: C_SNAPSTALL_1
Enum.description: Attempt to force any stalled load or store instruction to complete.

BitField.name: DBGKEY
BitField.description: Debug key:Software must write 0xA05F to this field to enable write accesses to bits [15:0], otherwise the processor ignores the write access.

BitField.name: REGSEL
BitField.description: REGSEL bits. Specifies the ARM core register, special-purpose register, or Floating-point extension register, to transfer.

BitField.name: REGWnR
BitField.description: REGWnR bit. Specifies the access type for the transfer.

BitField.name: DBGTMP
BitField.description: DBGTMP bits. Data temporary cache, for reading and writing the ARM core registers, special-purpose registers, and Floating-point extension registers.The value of this register is UNKNOWN:- on reset- if the processor is in Debug state, the debugger has written to DCRSR since entering Debug state and DHCSR.S_REGRDY is set to 0.

Register.name: DEMCR
Register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

BitField.name: VC_CORERESET
BitField.description: VC_CORERESET bit. Enable Reset Vector Catch. This causes a Local reset to halt a running system.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_CORERESET_0
Enum.description: Reset Vector Catch disabled.

Enum.name: VC_CORERESET_1
Enum.description: Reset Vector Catch enabled.

BitField.name: VC_MMERR
BitField.description: VC_MMERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a MemManage exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_MMERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_MMERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: VC_NOCPERR
BitField.description: VC_NOCPERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a UsageFault caused by an access to a Coprocessor.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_NOCPERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_NOCPERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: VC_CHKERR
BitField.description: VC_CHKERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a UsageFault exception caused by a checking error, for example an alignment check error.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_CHKERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_CHKERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: VC_STATERR
BitField.description: VC_STATERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a UsageFault exception caused by a state information error, for example an Undefined Instruction exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_STATERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_STATERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: VC_BUSERR
BitField.description: VC_BUSERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a BusFault exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_BUSERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_BUSERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: VC_INTERR
BitField.description: VC_INTERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a fault occurring during exception entry or exception return.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_INTERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_INTERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: VC_HARDERR
BitField.description: VC_HARDERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a HardFault exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_HARDERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_HARDERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: MON_EN
BitField.description: MON_EN bit. Enable the DebugMonitor exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 1, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: MON_EN_0
Enum.description: DebugMonitor exception disabled.

Enum.name: MON_EN_1
Enum.description: DebugMonitor exception enabled.

BitField.name: MON_PEND
BitField.description: MON_PEND bit. Sets or clears the pending state of the DebugMonitor exception.When the DebugMonitor exception is pending it becomes active subject to the exception priority rules. A debugger can use this bit to wakeup the monitor using the DAP.The effect of setting this bit to 1 is not affected by the value of the MON_EN bit.A debugger can set MON_PEND to 1, and force the processor to take a DebugMonitor exception, even when MON_EN is set to 0.

Enum.name: MON_PEND_0
Enum.description: Clear the status of the DebugMonitor exception to not pending.

Enum.name: MON_PEND_1
Enum.description: Set the status of the DebugMonitor exception to pending.

BitField.name: MON_STEP
BitField.description: MON_STEP bit. When MON_EN is set to 0, this feature is disabled and the processor ignores MON_STEP.When MON_EN is set to 1, the meaning of MON_STEP is:0 = Do not step the processor.1 = Step the processor.Setting this bit to 1 makes the step request pending. The request becomes active when the processor returns from the DebugMonitor handler to the code being debugged. The effect of setting this bit to 1 is UNPREDICTABLE if the code being debugged is executing at an execution priority that is lower than the priority of the DebugMonitor exception.This is the debug monitor equivalent of DHCSR.C_STEP in Debug state.

Enum.name: MON_STEP_0
Enum.description: Do not step the processor.

Enum.name: MON_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: MON_REQ
BitField.description: DebugMonitor semaphore bit. The processor does not use this bit. The monitor software defines the meaning and use of this bit.

BitField.name: TRCENA
BitField.description: TRCENA bit. Global enable for all DWT and ITM features.If the DWT and ITM blocks are not implemented, this bit is UNK/SBZP.When TRCENA is set to 0:- DWT registers return UNKNOWN values on reads. Whether the processor ignores writes to the DWT unit is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.- ITM registers return UNKNOWN values on reads. Whether the processor ignores writes to the ITM unit is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.Setting this bit to 0 might not stop all events. To ensure all events are stopped, software must set all DWT and ITM feature enable bits to 0, and then set this bit to 0.The effect of this bit on the TPIU, ETM, and other system trace components is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

Enum.name: TRCENA_0
Enum.description: DWT and ITM blocks disabled.

Enum.name: TRCENA_1
Enum.description: DWT and ITM blocks enabled.

BitField.name: ASC
BitField.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

Enum.name: ASC_0
Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is absent

Enum.name: ASC_1
Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present

BitField.name: AMC
BitField.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

Enum.name: AMC_0
Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent

Enum.name: AMC_1
Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present

Enum.name: CBRR_0
Enum.description: Fixed-priority arbitration

Enum.name: CBRR_1
Enum.description: Round-robin arbitration

Enum.name: SRAMUAP_0
Enum.description: Round robin

Enum.name: SRAMUAP_1
Enum.description: Special round robin (favors SRAM backdoor accesses over the processor)

Enum.name: SRAMUAP_2
Enum.description: Fixed priority. Processor has highest, backdoor has lowest

Enum.name: SRAMUAP_3
Enum.description: Fixed priority. Backdoor has highest, processor has lowest

Enum.name: SRAMLAP_0
Enum.description: Round robin

Enum.name: SRAMLAP_1
Enum.description: Special round robin (favors SRAM backdoor accesses over the processor)

Enum.name: SRAMLAP_2
Enum.description: Fixed priority. Processor has highest, backdoor has lowest

Enum.name: SRAMLAP_3
Enum.description: Fixed priority. Backdoor has highest, processor has lowest

Enum.name: CWBER_0
Enum.description: No error

Enum.name: CWBER_1
Enum.description: Error occurred

Enum.name: FIOC_0
Enum.description: No interrupt

Enum.name: FIOC_1
Enum.description: Interrupt occurred

Enum.name: FDZC_0
Enum.description: No interrupt

Enum.name: FDZC_1
Enum.description: Interrupt occurred

Enum.name: FOFC_0
Enum.description: No interrupt

Enum.name: FOFC_1
Enum.description: Interrupt occurred

Enum.name: FUFC_0
Enum.description: No interrupt

Enum.name: FUFC_1
Enum.description: Interrupt occurred

Enum.name: FIXC_0
Enum.description: No interrupt

Enum.name: FIXC_1
Enum.description: Interrupt occurred

Enum.name: FIDC_0
Enum.description: No interrupt

Enum.name: FIDC_1
Enum.description: Interrupt occurred

Enum.name: CWBEE_0
Enum.description: Disable error interrupt

Enum.name: CWBEE_1
Enum.description: Enable error interrupt

Enum.name: FIOCE_0
Enum.description: Disable interrupt

Enum.name: FIOCE_1
Enum.description: Enable interrupt

Enum.name: FDZCE_0
Enum.description: Disable interrupt

Enum.name: FDZCE_1
Enum.description: Enable interrupt

Enum.name: FOFCE_0
Enum.description: Disable interrupt

Enum.name: FOFCE_1
Enum.description: Enable interrupt

Enum.name: FUFCE_0
Enum.description: Disable interrupt

Enum.name: FUFCE_1
Enum.description: Enable interrupt

Enum.name: FIXCE_0
Enum.description: Disable interrupt

Enum.name: FIXCE_1
Enum.description: Enable interrupt

Enum.name: FIDCE_0
Enum.description: Disable interrupt

Enum.name: FIDCE_1
Enum.description: Enable interrupt

Enum.name: BEMD_0
Enum.description: User mode

Enum.name: BEMD_1
Enum.description: Supervisor/privileged mode

Enum.name: BESZ_0
Enum.description: 8-bit access

Enum.name: BESZ_1
Enum.description: 16-bit access

Enum.name: BESZ_2
Enum.description: 32-bit access

Enum.name: BEWT_0
Enum.description: Read access

Enum.name: BEWT_1
Enum.description: Write access

Enum.name: BEOVR_0
Enum.description: No bus error overrun

Enum.name: BEOVR_1
Enum.description: Bus error overrun occurred. The FADR and FDR registers and the other FATR bits are not updated to reflect this new bus error.

Enum.name: CPOREQ_0
Enum.description: Request is cleared.

Enum.name: CPOREQ_1
Enum.description: Request Compute Operation.

Enum.name: CPOACK_0
Enum.description: Compute operation entry has not completed or compute operation exit has completed.

Enum.name: CPOACK_1
Enum.description: Compute operation entry has completed or compute operation exit has not completed.

Enum.name: CPOWOI_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: CPOWOI_1
Enum.description: When set, the CPOREQ is cleared on any interrupt or exception vector fetch.

Enum.description: (??TBD?? current content from "MSCM OCMEM Configuration Register Descriptions"). Writes to the LMDRn[7:0] are ignored.

BitField.name: DPW
BitField.description: LMEM Data Path Width. This read-only field defines the width of the local memory.

Enum.name: DPW_2
Enum.description: LMEMn 32-bits wide

Enum.name: DPW_3
Enum.description: LMEMn 64-bits wide

Enum.name: WY_0
Enum.description: No Cache

Enum.name: WY_2
Enum.description: 2-Way Set Associative

Enum.name: WY_4
Enum.description: 4-Way Set Associative

BitField.name: LMSZ
BitField.description: (??TBD?? current content from "MSCM OCMEM Configuration Register Descriptions")

Enum.name: LMSZ_0
Enum.description: no LMEMn (0 KB)

Enum.name: LMSZ_1
Enum.description: 1 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_2
Enum.description: 2 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_3
Enum.description: 4 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_4
Enum.description: 8 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_5
Enum.description: 16 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_6
Enum.description: 32 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_7
Enum.description: 64 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_8
Enum.description: 128 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_9
Enum.description: 256 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_10
Enum.description: 512 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_11
Enum.description: 1024 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_12
Enum.description: 2048 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_13
Enum.description: 4096 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_14
Enum.description: 8192 KB LMEMn

Enum.name: LMSZ_15

BitField.name: LMSZH
BitField.description: (??TBD?? current content from "MSCM OCMEM Configuration Register Descriptions")

Enum.name: LMSZH_0
Enum.description: LMEMn is a power-of-2 capacity.

Enum.name: LMSZH_1
Enum.description: LMEMn is not a power-of-2, with a capacity is 0.75 * LMSZ.

BitField.name: V
BitField.description: Local memory Valid bit. This read-only field defines the validity (presence) of the local memory.

Enum.name: V_0
Enum.description: (??TBD?? current content from "MSCM OCMEM Configuration Register Descriptions"). LMEMn is not present.

Enum.name: V_1
Enum.description: (??TBD?? current content from "MSCM OCMEM Configuration Register Descriptions"). LMEMn is present.

Enum.name: ERNCR_0
Enum.description: reporting disabled

Enum.name: ERNCR_1
Enum.description: reporting enabled

Enum.name: ER1BR_0
Enum.description: reporting disabled

Enum.name: ER1BR_1
Enum.description: reporting enabled

Enum.name: ERPR_0
Enum.description: reporting disabled

Enum.name: ERPR_1
Enum.description: reporting enabled

Enum.name: ECPR_0
Enum.description: reporting disabled

Enum.name: ECPR_1
Enum.description: reporting enabled

BitField.name: PEELOC
BitField.description: Parity or ECC Error Location 5'h00 - a non-correctable ECC event from SRAM_L 5'h01 - a non-correctable ECC event from SRAM_U 5'h08 - a 1-bit correctable ECC event from SRAM_L 5'h09 - a 1-bit correctable ECC event from SRAM_U 5'h14 - a PC Tag Parity Error 5'h15 - a PC Data Parity Error

BitField.name: PEFPRT
BitField.description: Parity/ECC Fault Protection FATR[3] is Cacheable: 0=Non-cacheable, 1=Cacheable FATR[2] is Bufferable: 0=Non-bufferable, 1=Bufferable FATR[1] is Mode: 0=User mode, 1=Supervisor mode FATR[0] is Type: 0=I-Fetch, 1=Data

BitField.name: PEFSIZE
BitField.description: Parity/ECC Fault Master Size 3'b000 = 8-bit access 3'b001 = 16-bit access 3'b010 = 32-bit access 3'b011 = 64-bit access 3'b1xx = Reserved

BitField.name: PEFDH
BitField.description: Parity or ECC Fault Data High

BitField.name: PEFDL
BitField.description: Parity or ECC Fault Data Low

Enum.name: ENCACHE_0
Enum.description: Cache disabled

Enum.name: ENCACHE_1
Enum.description: Cache enabled

Enum.name: ENWRBUF_0
Enum.description: Write buffer disabled

Enum.name: ENWRBUF_1
Enum.description: Write buffer enabled

BitField.name: PCCR2
BitField.description: Forces all cacheable spaces to write through

BitField.name: PCCR3
BitField.description: Forces no allocation on cache misses (must also have PCCR2 asserted)

Enum.name: INVW0_0
Enum.description: No operation

Enum.name: INVW0_1
Enum.description: When setting the GO bit, invalidate all lines in way 0.

Enum.name: PUSHW0_0
Enum.description: No operation

Enum.name: PUSHW0_1
Enum.description: When setting the GO bit, push all modified lines in way 0

Enum.name: INVW1_0
Enum.description: No operation

Enum.name: INVW1_1
Enum.description: When setting the GO bit, invalidate all lines in way 1

Enum.name: PUSHW1_0
Enum.description: No operation

Enum.name: PUSHW1_1
Enum.description: When setting the GO bit, push all modified lines in way 1

Enum.name: GO_0
Enum.description: Write: no effect. Read: no cache command active.

Enum.name: GO_1
Enum.description: Write: initiate command indicated by bits 27-24. Read: cache command active.

Enum.name: LGO_0
Enum.description: Write: no effect. Read: no line command active.

Enum.name: LGO_1
Enum.description: Write: initiate line command indicated by bits 27-24. Read: line command active.

Enum.name: WSEL_0
Enum.description: Way 0

Enum.name: WSEL_1
Enum.description: Way 1

Enum.name: LCMD_0
Enum.description: Search and read or write

Enum.name: LADSEL_0
Enum.description: Cache address

Enum.name: LADSEL_1
Enum.description: Physical address

Enum.name: LGO_0
Enum.description: Write: no effect. Read: no line command active.

Enum.name: LGO_1
Enum.description: Write: initiate line command indicated by bits CLCR[27:24]. Read: line command active.

BitField.name: INTLINESNUM
BitField.description: The total number of interrupt lines supported by an implementation, defined in groups of 32.

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISFPCA
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame
